characters: I HAVE NOTHING. THE TIME IS COMING
I HAVE NOTHING. THE TIME TO DIE IS ...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK FARMER'S FACE -
dialogues.text: mid to late 30s, peers intently over a smoking gun.     H is The Bodyguard.

dialogues.speaker: HIT MAN
dialogues.text: dead on his  feet, leans against a car. A gun drops heavily from  his hand. His life ebbs as he slides slowly down the car  door to his knees then falls forward, face down on the  cement floor. A SLOW PULL BACK reveals that FRANK is lying on top of KLINGMAN. Protectively pressed body to body on the filthy cement floor of the garage. Klingman, a handsome, 50-year-old arbitrageur, gasps in barely controlled fear as his Armani suit soaks up a black pool of oil. There is no movement. The two men are lying near the right front fender of a black limousine. Blood spreads from the body of the hit man, a few yards away. Klingman starts to raise himself up but Farmer keeps him pressed to the floor, still alert for any further threat. MAIN TITLES BEGIN. A beat, and VOICES are heard O.S.   Farmer wheels, snub- nosed .357 aimed at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze!

dialogues.speaker: DOORWAY TO GARAGE
dialogues.text: A uniformed chauffeur freezes in his tracks.   Farmer lowers his weapon and speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calm, but an order)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call 911.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA has CRANED UP TO a high, almost-frozen WIDE SHOT o the scene. It TRACKS AWAY INTO darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passing traffic reveals the storefront of a TV showroom. Inside, behind the reflections of the city lights, all the TV sets are showing the same picture, the glittering image of a woman singing. (We will recognize the woman as Rachel Marron.) We cut tighter and tighter on the image until it is almost broken up into its scanning lines. Through the city noise comes the sound of her song "I have Nothing."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A battered old desk.  Scattered across the top -- a pile of blank white paper, a jar of glue, a stack of magazines, a pair of scissors, a TV remote control, softly in the b.g., a TV is playing the same image we saw in the store window, the same song. Hands appear. Male hands. They open a drawer and remove a pair of translucent rubber gloves. Carefully they put t gloves on. The SNAPPING of the rubber is the only sound. The hands pick a magazine off the stack: Screen Stars. They put the magazine down and pick up the scissors. A headline on the cover reads: "RACHEL MARRON'S GREATEST TRIUMPH!" The scissors start to cut. Meticulously they excise the name "RACHEL MARRON" from the page. With the care of a surgeon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tumultuous crash of screaming, pushing bodies. Arms stretch out, cameras flash, sunguns flare, microphones are thrust forward. A deafening cacophony of "Rachel! Rachel! Rachel! Over here! Over here! This way, Rachel! Rachel! Rachel!" We cannot see the object of this frenzy. We catch a brief glimpse of an attractive, well-dressed young woman (NICKI), exiting with the other celebrities, as she is pushed and casually jostled aside by the mass of surging fans and media. Her face is calm and impassive as she watches from the sidelines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a paneled room tastefully hung with a few choice paint ings that reflect Klingman's success as an arbitrageur, he pours two snifters of brandy as he speaks with Farmer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your hands ever shake, Frank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes.   It's just adrenaline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... How did you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw him washing the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't wash cars on the parking levels. He hands a glass of brandy to Frank, who looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I'd like you to stay on. He passes a small sealed envelope to Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not good in permanent positions, my feet go to sleep. The two men smile at each other. They raise their glasses in a joint salutation -- Klingman drinks. Frank doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rubber-gloved hands are glueing the word "TIME" onto a message that is taking the classic form of a ransom note. Each word has been cut from a different page and is in a different typeface. The note is being assembled with such care that it has an unusually neat appearance and is quite easy to read. It reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blur of hands and faces. Excited fans. Pieces of paper, autograph books, notes are thrust forward INTO the CAMERA Again, a mass chanting "Rachel! Rachel! Rachel!" Hands of Rachel's entourage accept some of the proffered items. In CLOSEUP, we see Rachel's hands signing "Best wishes,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel Marron" on an out-stretched open palm. In the midst of the urgent forest of hands and paper, a be- ribboned black doll is thrust forward, bearing the legend

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLAM of a CAR DOOR. Frank gets out of a cab with two suitcases. His house is a modest stucco affair on a small lot. He goes up the walk and puts down his suit- cases. He looks at rampant foliage and overgrown grass. Supermarket circulars cover his doorstep. He picks up a few and fishes a bunch of keys from his pocket. A curious neighbor peers from behind a net curtain. As the door opens, we are aware of a further pile of mail inside. Frank's feet push the letters aside and go inside. The door shuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farmer has carefully set a place for himself at the table in a breakfast nook. A bottle of red wine is open with a glass beside it. At the stove he stirs and flavors a Boeuf Bourgignon and reads a Time magazine. He adds a splash of wine. He lifts the pot from the stove and tries a piece of meat. At the table, he looks at the place setting and absently eats another piece of meat. Finally he sets the pot on the plate and eats from it directly while glancing through the magazine.

dialogues.speaker: CORNER OF DRESSING TA
dialogues.text: Lots of people are schmoozing in the dressing room. There's a loud buzz of excited chatter. Hands are stack- ing flowers, good luck messages, cards and cables by the mirror. Through the blur and bustle, we glimpse the doll with its embroidered ribbon message "RACHEL, WE LOVE YOU. Hands casually move it to one side, among the flowers resting on the small portable TV set. On the screen is an image of Rachel performing on stage, acknowledging applause, bowing. The doll EXPLODES, SHATTERING the TV, the MIRROR and the LIGHT BULBS. The SCREEN GOES BLACK, amid SHOUTS, SCREAMS and CONFUSION. TITLES END.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank lounges in his shorts under the single tree, sun- glasses on, a glass of iced tea by his side. Strains of "DON'T WALK AWAY RENEE" come from a beat-up transistor RADIO. An old-fashioned lawn sprinkler lazily waves water back and forth over the freshly cut grass.  Throwing knives lay scattered nearby. A wooden post is  sticking out of the ground in front of the fence at the back of the yard. BILL DEVANEY, fiftyish, a distinguished-looking black gentleman, stands nearby trying to engage Frank in a conversation that up to this point hasn't been going well He's Rachel's personal manager.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you won't protect Rachel Marron just because she's in show business?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't do celebrities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the biggest money's in show business people. Frank says nothing. His  eyes are  closed behind the sun- glasses. Devaney picks  up one of  the throwing knives. He holds it carefully by the blade  and throws it. It misses the post by three feet and  clatters against the fence. Frank opens his eyes, sees what's going on and closes his eyes again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (picking up another knife)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you really do these things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't she the one who collects dolls? This is enough to distract Devaney from his knife-throwin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exasperated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farmer, Rachel Marron is one of the most famous people in America. She's won every music award invented. She's got the number one song in the country right now and she'll probably be nominated for an Oscar in her very

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: first picture. And you want to know 'Isn't she the one...?' Christ, man, where've you been? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean she doesn't collect dolls? DEVANEY (defeated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.    She collects dolls. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I knew who she was. Devaney tries to size up whether Frank is kidding him or not. Frank's face betrays nothing. Devaney gestures with a knife. DEVANEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're probably deadly with these things, aren't you? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deadly. DEVANEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show me. Frank doesn't move. DEVANEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you resisting this job? $2,000 bucks a week. (no response) $2,500. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are several good men available for that kind of money. Have you talked to Fitzgerald or Racine? Portman? DEVANEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   Portman was interested... He senses an opening and sits down beside Frank for what he takes to be the first serious talk. DEVANEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... but we're told you're the best. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no such thing. DEVANEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farmer, we're talking about a very frightened lady. With a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: seven-year old son. Believe me, I wouldn't be here if I didn't think this was for real. (long pause) Farmer, she begged me to get you. Frank sits up finally and looks at Devaney a long time. He picks up five throwing knives and stands up. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. I'll come and I'll look the situation over. If I take it, it's three thousand a week. DEVANEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whistles) Okay. You must be very deadly for three grand a week. Frank is now about twenty feet from the wooden post. throws one of the knives. It misses the post and clatters against the fence. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Devaney's face drops.   Frank examines the next knife. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mumbling) I know it's something like... The second knife gets away from him at the top of his arc and disappears into some bushes about three feet from Devaney. Devaney stands up in a hurry and moves behind Frank. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Frank raises his hand to throw again, then stops and motions Devaney off to the side. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better not stand right behind me. Devaney smiles weakly. Frank lets the third knife go with one smooth motion. The knife sinks an inch into the center of the post. Frank's hand arching again.     Throwing the remaining kn Both knives stick in the post forming a straight vertical line with the first one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank stops his nondescript Chevy across the quiet street from the closed, unmanned gate at the bottom of the Marro driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as he looks over the gate, the wall, the heavy vegetation and the rising grounds beyond. (NOTE: The use of the term FRANK'S POV, is not to be taken simply as a camera direction. Rather, it re- presents a recurring attempt to make the audience see in the special way Frank sees. Frank lives by constant vigilance, heightened awareness. It is his genius and his burden. The audience must be put in the position of looking, searching, scanning with him.) He has a curious sense of being watched, a kind of prick- ling on the back of his neck. As he looks around, a black Toyota 4X4, parked some way down the road, drives rapidly off -- too fast to get a clear look. He watches it go. Frank pulls up   to the gate and gets out of his car. He grabs a bar of   the gate and pulls. The whole gate rattles. Frank    gets back in his car and pushes a butto on the intercom   box at the side of the gate. A MAN'S VOICE CRACKLES   out of the BOX. Transmission is terrible

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank Farmer to see Miss Marron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexander Graham Bell to see Miss Marron!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (obviously has not heard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you got an appointment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The atomic number of zinc is 30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. There is a LOUD BUZZING and the gate swings arthritically open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as he moves up the winding drive through heavily land- scaped grounds. Plenty of potential hiding places. The mansion is at the top of the hill. The grounds behind the mansion fall away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mansion is huge. On and on it goes. Frank drives PAST the garage area where HENRY, the chauffeur, is polishing the mascot on the limousine. One of his arms is bandaged. Henry peers at Frank, puts down his cloth and walks toward the entrance where Frank is parking. Frank gets out, looks around. A painter's truck is parked nearby, two painters unloading equipment from it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you the man on the intercom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Edison. I have an appointment with Miss Marron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.   And that was arranged by...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impressed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Devaney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go right ahead, Mr. Edison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to your arm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at his arm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A doll. He goes back to the limousine. Frank RINGS the DOORBELL, although the door is not shut. EMMA, a fiftyish housekeeper, appears. A man in cover- alls comes out past her, carrying a length of timber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry Ford, to see Mr. Devaney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank steps into the foyer with Emma. She is a warm, matronly woman who does a fine job running the house without standing on custom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you quite honestly, Mr. Ford, I don't know where Mr. Devaney is. Did he say he'd be here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he probably is.   Let me look. She leads Frank into a large, unused formal parlor. There are dustsheets over the furniture and the walls are being repainted. On a number of TV screens scattered around, Rachel's latest video (the one we saw in the opening titles) is continuously playing. The sound of the song itself -- "I HAVE NOTHING" -- comes softly from concealed speakers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please make yourself at home. Can I get you anything? Frank demurs and Emma disappears back through the foyer. Frank watches her go, then moves off into the house in the opposite direction. It's obviously undergoing a major redecoration. Painters, decorators and designers come and go, oblivious to Frank's presence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The deeper Frank walks into the house, the warmer and more lived-in rooms appear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank steps into a tiled room that overlooks the pool area. One wall is all glass. On the opposite wall are shelves containing the trophies of Rachel Marron's career A Tony award, three Grammy's, gold and platinum records, other statuettes and plaques. Among the framed photo- graphs of Rachel accepting awards etc., is one of her and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: her small son, FLETCHER, dressed in a tuxedo. Both are goofing off for the camera with obvious affection. Frank looks down at the pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwarfed by the pool, the only person in sight is seven- year old Fletcher, the little boy from the photograph, dark-haired and fragile. He is crouched at the side of the pool with the remote control unit for a foot-long speedboat which is cutting across the water. A nanny sits, some way off, embroidering. Frank's attention is distracted. A heavier BASS MUSICAL BEAT comes from somewhere nearby in the house, another Rachel Marron number, but this time up-tempo and bouncy. Frank follows the sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank walks into the rear of the room that the noise is coming from. It is large and comfortable with plenty of seating, a bar, a wall of stereo gear and a projection booth. It is packed with people, props and video equipment. There is lots of activity, a general air of barely-organized chaos. MUSIC BLARES out. A group of six dancers, is rehearsing an energetic dance number for a music video, directed by their choreographer RORY. Sunlight throws them in a silhouette against the glass wall at the end of the room. A video cameraman circles them, taping the rehearsal, which appears on a large-screen TV behind them. In one corner, a pretty black girl is being pinned into a proposed costume for the video. Several people are stand- ing around, tending to the video and playback gear. All the chairs face the far end of the room and it isn't immediately apparent how many more people are hidden amon the big cushions. As Frank sits on the barstool at the back, a large swivel chair turns to reveal Devaney. He waves to Frank and makes his way over to him. On the other side of the room, a brawny, heavyset man in late thirties rises to look at Frank. He has a twenty inc neck. Devaney signals to him  that everything is all righ The brawny man looks at Frank a moment more, then sits do Frank looks around the room. A shelf laden with vitamins. Guitars of various makes. A flute. A gold record being used as a coaster. People smoking and chatting through the rehearsal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In one of the chairs, a pretty  woman in her  mid-thirtie (NICKI, the woman we saw at the  premiere) is  knitting. She glances occasionally at the  dancers. A   man sits ne to a phone busily discussing a  contract with  someone at the other end of the line. The music climaxes and abruptly stops. The dancers hold their dramatic final poses for a second, then relax again APPLAUSE. The CLAPPING from the front sofa is loudest. Then LAUGHTER. From elsewhere in the room comes the voice of the VIDEO DIRECTOR. DIRECTOR (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Playback, everybody! Rachel's voice comes from the sofa. RACHEL (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here, Rory! The choreographer skips to the sofa and disappears from sight. Sound of kissing, laughter. The video rewinds on the big screen and the dancers gathe round it expectantly. RACHEL (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sugar, that's gonna be great.    I love the ending... Devaney moves to the front of the room. The PLAYBACK STARTS behind him. There are several overlapping conversations going on. DEVANEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel... RACHEL (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicki, how'd you like the number? You like the end routine? DIRECTOR (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel. You wanna see it back from the beginning or just the ending... NICKI, responds to Rachel's question. NICKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was just great, Rory... But Rachel is already replying to the video director.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna see it all. Tony?      I'll bet Tony loved it. The brawny man, Tony, shrugs and stands to look at Frank as he speaks. TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ehh! RACHEL (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Rory. Tony doesn't appreciate great art. The pinned-up girl has been brought forward for Rachel's approval, elbowing Devaney a little to one side. DRESS DESIGNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (showing the costume) What do you think, Rachel? DEVANEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel, Frank Farmer is... RACHEL (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Devaney, do you think this is me? DEVANEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not looking) It's terrific... Devaney is now facing the unseen Rachel. DEVANEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel, Frank Farmer is here. Devaney nods in Frank's direction.     Nicki looks at Fra RACHEL (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's here? DEVANEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank Farmer. (getting no response) The bodyguard. RACHEL (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think Rory should be my bodyguard. (to dress designer) Let's see the back again... DEVANEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel, raise your butt out of there and meet this man. RACHEL MARRON finally rises from the sofa.     It's a bit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a shock to see that she is only about thirty years old. A young woman. Not beautiful, not ugly. Unique only in that she is immediately interesting. A Superstar. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm up. Rachel and Frank look across the room at each other. Frank comes forward. DEVANEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank Farmer, Rachel Marron. Rachel offers her hand and they shake.    Rachel looks hi up and down. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't look like a bodyguard. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you expect? RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Tough guy maybe. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my disguise. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Well, his timing's good. DEVANEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Nicki, Rachel's sister and personal secretary. NICKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you, Mr. Farmer. DEVANEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating) ... Tony Scibelli. Tony nods but makes no move to shake hands. Rachel dismisses the Dress Designer. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to designer) The back's still not right... SPECTOR, still on the phone, offers a perfunctory wave. DEVANEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Sy Spector, Rachel's publicist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we get you a drink? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orange juice. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Straight?   Nicki. Nicki goes to the bar. Rachel sits and motions for Frank to sit opposite her. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rory, I'll be with you in a second. Rory gets up, and goes over to his dancers at the big screen video. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, this whole thing is Bill's idea... This sudden obsession with protecting me. Tony has always handled my security and we've done just fine. SPECTOR (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Yes, I'll hold but not long... RORY (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel, you want to run through your steps before we go again...? RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be with you in a second. Nicki hands Frank his orange juice.   She looks at Frank she speaks. NICKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think Bill's right, Rachel. It's time you took more precautions. Spector enters the conversation. SPECTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (one hand covers the phone) Nicki, I'm sure Mr. Farmer would tell you the number of nuts writing fan letters jumps every time Rachel is on the cover of a magazine. DEVANEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ASSISTANT hands Rachel a small sheaf of phone messages some papers for signature and a pen. Rachel checks through them and signs as she talks. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax guys, I said I'd do  it. You see what I'm dealing with  here? I'm willing to go along,  as long as we all understand each  other. I'm not going to let this  alter my life one little bit. (to assistant) Who was this? ASSISTANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping Devaney) Oh. That was Clive's office. They called three times... DEVANEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, that's not going to be a problem. DEVANEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Frank) Rachel runs a very informal household, we're all on a first name basis... Spector has finished up on the phone and jumps in. SPECTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And I'm sure you'll blend in just fine. You can select whatever alarm systems you want for the house. Some kind of improved security for the gate. What else, Rachel? Rachel stands and starts to wander over to Rory and the dancers. Frank looks at Devaney.   Devaney doesn't like the tone this is taking. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'm safe when I'm here at the house so I guess the main thing will be when I go out. Tony will be able to fill you in on all that. You two will have to work something out. I don't want both of you falling all over me everywhere I go. The most important thing is this -- I will not allow Fletcher to be affected by this thing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rory puts his arm around her waist and stands behind her, starting to run through her steps with her in slow motion SPECTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (punching phone) I was just going to cover that. We'll have to tell the child you have some other function... RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want him to think   he's in prison. So the house and    grounds must not be altered in any   way. He shouldn't be aware that   you're here. Is that clear? Frank looks at her a long time, glancing up at Devaney once. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Marron... RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's been a mistake. A misunderstanding. If you'll show me the quickest way out, we'll save each other a lot of trouble. Frank's on his way. Someone brings a silver headpiece on a stand to Rachel. She ignores it, still looking at Frank TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can go past the pool. DEVANEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Tony. FARMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice meeting you. DEVANEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farmer, will you wait a minute? SPECTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill, I don't think we should be begging this guy for his services. DEVANEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sy, I'm handling this. Rachel looks on coolly as Frank slides open the glass doo DEVANEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farmer, will you wait a minute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank is walking rapidly away from the window wall, down the slope. Devaney is scurrying to keep up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farmer, will you wait a minute? I should have told you more. I'm sorry but I was afraid she wouldn't go through with it. I thought I'd let the two of you work it out... come to an understanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did. Frank starts to walk off.   Devaney is grasping at straws

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not a bad person, and whether she knows it or not, she needs you. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've come this far... Would you just wait here for one minute. I want to show you something. Please, Farmer. Devaney runs back to the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher, happy to have someone to talk to,  walks up to Frank with his remote-control speed boat.   Frank would like to walk away, but Fletcher blocks his  way. Frank looks at Fletcher's frail little, nut-brown  figure. The watching nanny continues her embroidering,  some way off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing to walk)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wants to keep walking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. How 'bout yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm fine. Do you like boats?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank gives up.    He's not going to get out of here.   H stops. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.     I don't like boats. FLETCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't!     Why not? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I don't know. FLETCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure you do, but you don't want to tell me. Frank considers him, then slips out of his sport coat. He crouches down so that he is eye-level with Fletcher. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a smart kid. Fletcher nods. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you. One time I was stuck on a boat with some people for four months. FLETCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lifeboat? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. A big white yacht.      Do you know what a yacht is? FLETCHER (thinks about this)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.     My mom rented this huge yacht    once, and we took a trip. It was    great. Everyone threw up except    me. I love 'em. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (standing to leave) Well, nobody's perfect. Fletcher squints up at him, the sun in his eyes. FLETCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the bodyguard, aren't you? Frank is surprised. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you know about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll remember that. Devaney trots into the pool area, out of breath. He is holding a bulging manila file. As he sees Fletcher, he holds the file casually at his side. Frank sees Fletcher looking at the file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you, Fletch? (to Frank)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you waited.    Let's go over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Fletcher)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice meeting you. Fletcher looks after them silently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Devaney slides the file across the table at Frank, open- ing it. Inside are letters of every size and condition. Repeatedly throughout this scene Frank's gaze is drawn to Fletcher, who has started his boat again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is just in the last six months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at the pile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever tried having these professionally assessed? Devaney shakes his head no. Frank begins to look through the letters, flipping them b the corner of the page. From many different sources, some are scrawled, some typed, some assembled from cutouts. Many are soiled and torn, others immaculate. Occasionally one will have a photo of Rachel with crude markings on it Spector enters sucking on a popsicle. He comes to stand over Frank's shoulder, peering nonchalantly at the piles of letters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Devaney says you were in the Secret Service. Frank nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank goes through them quickly, with an expert eye. He sometimes pauses to read one more carefully. A few he removes from the stack and places in the center of the table. SPECTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever guard the main man? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was two years with Carter and four years with Reagan. Frank sets another letter in the center pile.   He stops, smiling at it. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a little old lady in Akron. She's written to everybody I've ever worked for. He continues to turn until something stops him. Several letters are paper-clipped together. They are the pasted- up type we saw being assembled on the desk top. SPECTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reagan got shot. His chatter is beginning to annoy Frank. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not on my shift. Spector emits a gratuitous laugh, acknowledges the joke. SPECTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good. Frank goes back to his letters.   He taps the stack in the center of the table. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first glance, these don't bother me. But keep them. You never know. He separates one letter from the others. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This could be something. Devaney searches Frank's face. DEVANEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think it could be the same guy? The one who rigged the doll?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Did you tell Miss Marron about it? Does she know about the doll? Devaney and Spector exchange looks.   This is evidently a sore point between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We said there'd been some electrical problem while she was on stage. Short circuit. Look, she doesn't need that kind of worry right now. It would upset her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the police?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was no reason for the police. No one got hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the chauffeur?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was nothing. It was just our people there. Frank turns and watches Fletcher by the pool.   Devaney's eyes are still on Frank's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sy, I think we should show him the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank follows Spector and Devaney into the room. He glances around, taking in the murals, the decor, the kitsch attempt at fornicatorial splendour right from the pages of a tabloid layout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this her bedroom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. She sleeps in a room next to Fletcher's down the hall. Sy had this done for a magazine layout,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Superstars in their Boudoirs.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see it? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. DEVANEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel never liked it. SPECTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't have to like it... Devaney gently lays the cut-out letter on the bed. DEVANEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We found the letter here. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody was in here? DEVANEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody broke in and ... masturbated on the bed. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she doesn't know about this either? Devaney shakes his head. SPECTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? This would really freak her out. DEVANEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone penetrates the house, gets upstairs and jerks off on the bed ... I'd say that qualifies as a problem. DEVANEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of problem? SPECTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (agitated) Of fuck, we don't need this now... FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This house is wide open. SPECTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said this house is wide open

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and you people have no clue what real security is or what it takes to achieve it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (does a quick read on Frank)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, I totally respect what you're telling me. Tell me how you want to work and I'll accommodate you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I can't protect her. I won't be responsible for her safety if she doesn't know what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll talk to her, I'll make her understand. I can do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   I'll talk to her. Spector exits the room in a huff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank emerges with Devaney and crosses toward his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...She won't give you any static, Frank, you've got my word on that. Frank is still focused on Fletcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure she will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what job's perfect? You're a bodyguard, aren't you? Slowly, Frank faces him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. As they reach the car, Devaney is relieved.   He dares a perfect smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Devaney, if you ever lie to me again, I'll take you apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry Dupres is leaning against the doorjamb. The room is comfortable, a guest bedroom. Frank flops one battered suitcase onto the bed and opens it. He pulls open some drawers in the dresser and starts putting away his clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you say your name was Edison?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to see how hard it was to get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it wasn't, was it? Henry unconsciously flexes his fingers, easing the muscle in his hands. Frank notices and pulls out a small tube of ointment from a pouch he's unpacking. He hands it to Henr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put this on your arm.    It'll help the ache. Henry takes it but is noncommittal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bet you can fill up a whole day just washing the cars and driving Rachel Marron around town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're adding to your duties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're my new assistant. Frank removes three boxes of cartridges from the suitcase and puts them in the back of a dresser drawer as Henry watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Says who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry, I've spent a lot of time guarding people all over the world

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and I've found one thing to be true. No matter how incompetent the assassins, no matter how much they miss their target by, there's one person who always gets hit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cocky black chauffeur. Henry considers this for a moment and smiles. OVER scenes 26-28, we hear the VOICE of CNN's MARTIN GROVE from "Showbiz Today."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Oscar time again, folks, and with Academy members marking their ballots today for this year's nominations; some canny tipsters in Vegas have announced their picks for the Awards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Echoing the prevailing buzz in Hollywood, the Vegas Hilton is gambling on one sure thing at least. Newcomer Rachel Marron is tipped at 3 to 1 to lead this year's Best Actress runners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sultry singer made a notable acting debut last fall in Queen Of The Night, singing the hit song 'I Have Nothing'. The lady may end up eating her words if she takes home that statuette March 20th...

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The fortification of the estate begins as Frank and Henry walk the grounds. Frank talks and points, Henry takes notes on a pad. Frank gestures at the stonework of the gate, points at the top of the stone wall along Waverly Lane. At the tall hedges which separate the estate from its neighbors, Frank gestures to take in the entire length of the hedged border. Henry stops in amazement. Frank keeps walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher stands at the edge of the terrace, staring down across the rear grounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Henry are down there conferring about the fence.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: appears beside Fletcher, looks down there too, then leads her son purposefully away. Fletcher isn't happy about it.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Frank tours the house with Emma and Henry. Frank opens various doors, fidgets with locking mechanisms. Emma finds it all exciting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small room at one end of the pool house has been fitted with a wall mirror and ballet exercise barre. A STEREO plays exercising MUSIC. Nicki, dressed in leotards, is doing pre-aerobic stretch- ing exercises. Frank appears outside the window. Nicki waves him in. Unseen by Frank, a huge St. Bernard lays in the front of the door. He muscles his way in, the dog never moves, just slides along the floor as Frank pushes the door open. Frank looks the room over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unusual tactic for a guard dog, but effective. Nicki smiles, gesturing him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can look around if you like. Frank indicates it won't be necessary.   Nicki stops working out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to disturb you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all right. It's an excuse to rest. It's my private place. I'm the only one who works out around here. Frank glances at photos on one wall. Most are of Nicki from years ago; some show her performing with a band.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My own ego wall. No platinum records. Frank spots a picture of two girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and Rachel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was a kid, I put a little band together. We played high school dances, stuff like that. Then Rachel joined the act. As you can imagine, she was quite a little entertainer. Even then, she had a way of stopping the show. So I kind of quit. Professionally, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never went back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was pretty obvious who the star in our family was. Frank looks back at the picture.    Nicki smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Henry walk toward the closed garages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That depends on what you call a 'hint.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want anyone on the street to be able to look at the cars and know who owns them. Henry leans in a doorway and hits a master switch. The three doors of the garage start to rise in sequence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think there's anything here you'd call a 'hint.' One at a time the doors go up to reveal: First garage -- the Cadillac limousine we've seen earlier License: RACHEL 2 Second garage -- a gray Mercedes.    License:   RACHEL 3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Third garage -- a Jaguar XKE in an outrageous pink. No other car in the world is this color. License: RACHEL 1 Frank looks at Henry, who is laughing and shakes his head He walks toward the Jag. Frank releases the hood. He looks inside for a moment, then reaches into the guts of the engine. He fiddles for a second, then stands up holding some wires and slams the hood shut again. He gestures toward the other two cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get new plates for those two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fortification continues as workmen use a bulldozer to clear away the stonework around the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting beside Henry, Frank teaches him how to spin the limo in a 180 degree 'skid turn,' sending up clouds of dust. A group of roadies watching bursts into spontan- eous applause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher sits on the grass about halfway to the house, watching the activity with delighted interest. He turns as he spots something beyond the hedge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Workmen put up a seven-foot cyclone fence. Across the road, a black Toyota 4 X 4 is stopped. It slowly pulls away. We can't see inside it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One worker pries a small boulder out of a hole with a crowbar. His partner picks up the rock and tosses it on a small pile of rocks. The boulder bounces down the backside of the pile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel, looking out her window at Fletcher and the work- men, sees the rock stop a yard from him. Fletcher scrambles away, much as a kid might dance back from a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: wave on a beach.   The sight disturbs Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher!    C'mon. Back in here! As she speaks, some workmen test the remote control on a window shutter. It descends in front of Rachel's face. She is not amused. Fletcher passes Frank on his way to join Rachel. He mutters almost under his breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he's got a black 4 X 4. Could be a Chevy. More like a Toyota. Frank stares at Fletcher, then looks back to the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is dark. An opaque projector throws an image onto a screen; it is a letter threatening Rachel's life. We hear voices. One is Frank's; the other two belong to special agents RAY COURT and TERRY MINELLA. The letter is one of the pasted-up threats we saw being assembled earlier. It reads:

dialogues.speaker: WHEN YOU SHALL DIE...
dialogues.text: Reading as fast as possible, we pick up some vicious threats and obscenities, but we don't have time to read it all before we...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK'S FACE
dialogues.text: illuminated by the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This    is another of the ones we think    are worth pursuing. Lots of work    went into it. No prints. We're    doing lab work on it. It could    be nothing.

dialogues.speaker: MINELLA'S FACE
dialogues.text: is illuminated above the projector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the one you think is tied to the doll?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what her manager thinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This 'I Have Nothing' business is a natural with the record and movie and all. The projector light goes off and the room light goes on. The room is practically bare. Ray Court, a prematurely white-haired, career civil servant, raises the window shade. Sunlight streams in. On Court's lapel is a tiny P.T. Boat pin. Terry Minella, a slight, dark 35-year-old, offers Frank a cigarette; Frank declines, Minella lights up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sort of lost track of you after Washington.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the private stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (noncommittal)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big money, I bet? Huh? Frank shrugs.    Court looks at Minella knowingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Minella and Court walk Frank to the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. I knew it. It is big money. Fuck! You need an assistant? I'm ready to get out. I've lost my tolerance for assholic behavior. You should see the jerk we're covering now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Hellfire Henry' Kent...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh!    Somebody wants to pop him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which isn't exactly surprising, considering what the shithead's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: been saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!  Do everyone a favor... (he coughs, ironically)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you know, we're nonpolitical these days. The three men laugh easily together.   They have reached the lobby doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Frank)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll put this stuff through Washington. Behavioral Sciences should have something in a few days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. (a pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why am I getting all this cooperation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a big star. Important people care about her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Politics and show business are practically the same these days... Got any crowd photos we can use?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying to keep her away from crowds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's busy. Lots of customers arriving, leaving and seated at tables. Waiters criss-cross the terrace. Near the entrance, Rachel is saying goodbye to a middle-aged WOMAN. Frank stands nearby with Nicki. The Woman says something to Rachel, who turns and looks at Frank. Rachel whispers something to the Woman and they both laugh. They kiss and Rachel moves toward the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (an afterthought; phony)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Nicki. So great to see you. Nicki waves and follows Rachel. Frank stays very close without seeming to walk with Rachel. A little girl darts into their path and approaches Rachel Rachel glances at Frank, who has stopped with her, then she signs an autograph for the girl. The girl's mother, close behind her, hands a small camera casually to Nicki to be photographed as she and her daughter pose with Rachel. Frank watches Nicki quietly comply. Rachel, Spector and Frank all reach the front entrance together, and Frank slips out first, glancing around. Rachel comes out and passes within inches of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm surprised you didn't plug them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel attracts the usual stares from passersby. As they reach the limousine, Frank continues scanning the street. Tony stares at him, uncomprehending.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impatiently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, let's go. Frank takes a last look then gets into the front seat next to Tony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (across Tony)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O.K. Henry, let's go. Tony looks at Frank, eyes narrowing. From across the street, we see the limo pull away. As the shot clears, the dark shape of another vehicle appears, slowly moving into frame over the top of the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank sits beside Tony, next to the door.   Tony speaks to him in a near whisper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me set you straight on a few things. For starters, I love this lady... What I do for her I do for

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: love. I'm not some hired fuckin' gun who is out to make her life miserable. While Tony speaks, Frank's eyes dart to the side mirror; his gaze never leaves it.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK TOYOTA
dialogues.text: appears in the rearview mirror.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do things the way she likes. Her happiness is everything to me. Frank speaks while concentrating on the mirror. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem. I'd like to know how you handle things, Tony. TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I handle things fine, Frank. You watch me and you'll learn something. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Henry) Turn left. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that him? Frank shakes his head, he's not sure.   Tony reacts. TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what's going on? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shortcut.

dialogues.speaker: TOYOTA IN REARVIEW MIRROR
dialogues.text: As the limo turns, the 4 X 4 follows them into the turn.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: whispers to Henry. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow down, very slow. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to do a one-eighty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, just slow down. The car slows.

dialogues.speaker: SPECTOR AND RACHEL IN BACK
dialogues.text: They look up from some papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are we stopping?    Are we here? Behind them, THROUGH the rear window, the 4 X 4 can be seen. Sensing something, it makes a sudden TIRE- SCREECHING left turn, disappearing behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The limo enters the gate where workmen are rigging a large fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank speaks to Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop here... Take them to the house. Frank jumps out and jumps a hedge, racing toward the lawn and work area.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, RACHEL AND SPECTOR
dialogues.text: As the car pulls away they see Frank running wildly acros the property.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Frank comes through some bushes, he suddenly catches a glimpse of the 4 X 4 through the trees. It starts to accelerate. As it pulls away (it is too far to record the license number), he breaks into a full run toward the other end of the property. Leaping hedges, Frank crashes through tropical vegetation CRASHING through a bamboo forest, he scurries down a steep wooded slope toward the road below. The 4 X 4 can be glimpsed through the trees as he runs to head it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A retaining wall about   14 feet high rises from the road to the slope. Without    a pause, as the car speeds benea Frank leaps and drops   the full distance to the road. Th 4 X 4 ROARS PAST just   missing him and turns a corner. Hitting hard, Frank allows his knees to take the force of the fall, deliberately rolling once before he springs into a crouched upright position. But the 4 X 4 speeds around a corner and is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fortification  continues as workmen tighten screws, install electrical  wiring, test alarms. As Frank watches over the work, we  see him show Henry how to wear a SURV KIT communications  system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep this loose. Fletcher comes to take a look too.   He peers up at Frank expectantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about the car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toyota.     Black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four wheel drive? Late model? Frank nods.   Fletcher looks pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One snag though. Fletcher's face falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 360,000 of them in Los Angeles.    I checked. Nice work, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugging)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, nobody's perfect, Frank. Are they? (gesturing to the SURV KIT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I try that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel has been watching Fletcher and Frank down the hill. Now she leans back on the chaise lounge where she is sunning, trying to listen to a new song on a Walkman. There is the SCREECHING howl of a DRILL on METAL from the direction of the house. Rachel jumps up and yells toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up you assholes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mild-looking OLD LOCKSMITH is working on Rachel's window. Rachel walks in from the pool, starting to peel off the swimsuit. She stops, startled, as she sees him. This is the last straw. She blows up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clutching the swimsuit)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You! You! Out! Out!        Now!   Out of here! Get out! Terrified, the Old Locksmith drops his tools and begins backing out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, ma'am. Thank you. I'm a real fan of yours, Miss Marron. Still angry, but disarmed, Rachel makes a face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you can take your tools with you. She turns to the window, in what she imagines is Frank's general direction, and, like a little girl, suddenly sticks out her tongue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a BIG CLOSEUP ON a black and white TV screen, we see Devaney's immaculate convertible Mercedes 500SL as it roars up the drive. Frank, Henry and Fletcher watch in the newly-erected guard house. The area is greatly changed. There is a uniformed guard with an impressive array of switches, lights and phones at his command. There are several TV screens; one of them shows a series of endlessly-panning shots from cameras at the rear of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the grounds. On the other, the Mercedes kicks up dust from the last few curves in the drive. Fletcher shakes his head. He's seen it all before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that Devaney?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Frank)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's got him by the short ones, doesn't she, Frank? Frank squelches a smile at Henry.   Where did he learn that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, she makes him nervous. They watch as Devaney SCREECHES to a STOP, gets out and hurries inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicki is cutting fruit at the bar. Rachel, very tense, is taking the fruit and dropping it into a yogurt drink she's making in a blender. Rory, her choreographer, stands behind her, massaging her neck and shoulders. Spector is perched on a bar stool like a vulture. Devaney hurries into the room; Nicki gives him a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want him gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He told Rachel no Sunday brunch at Charlie's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Sunday brunch. That's why you called me up here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is not it! It's my money and my life and I want him out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he? Nicki indicates through the glass door.    Devaney walks over to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the patio. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's through messing with my life. DEVANEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel, I'm getting goddamn sick of running up here every time he steps on your toes. (leaning out the glass door) Farmer! Would you come in here a minute? Devaney walks back toward Rachel. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know he was nuts? SPECTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know who couldn't get past the gates yesterday? RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? SPECTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin Leach, that's who. Rory sniggers into the back of Rachel's hair, fighting off a laugh. Rachel has difficulty keeping a straight face, too. Spector glares at them as Frank enters from the sliding door. SPECTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think that's funny? The man talks to 20 million people and he can't even get in here. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he have an appointment? Devaney turns to him. DEVANEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farmer, what is this about brunch at Charlie's? Rachel's been going there every Sunday for the last five years. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want her doing anything she's always done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mimicking him) 'I don't want her doing anything she's always done.' The guy's a fanatic. DEVANEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So are the guys he's protecting you from. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me if I don't faint. NICKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think of Fletcher -- Rachel turns ON the BLENDER, drowning out Nicki's voice. Frank looks at Rachel coolly. She stares at him petulantly, then turns OFF the BLENDER. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know he's got the phones bugged? SPECTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus, Bill. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he gets off listening to my calls. All that heavy breathing... DEVANEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) What do you want from my life? RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want some peace around here. SPECTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. Devaney looks at Frank imploringly. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're almost done. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I want to be able to eat brunch with my friends. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on Tuesday this week. Spector looks at him as though he were a Martian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stretching it out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuesday -- morning -- brunch. Where did you find this guy? Rachel turns ON the BLENDER and stares at Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel's limousine is parked opposite the shop.    It's a decidedly downscale area. A little way  off, a   group of unemployed youths hang around, eyeing the limo   with interest. Henry sits  at the wheel. Tony  stands   by the open window, leaning against the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at the youths)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish Rachel didn't keep coming here. It makes me nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. 'Cept I'm not nervous 'cos I got you with me.

dialogues.speaker: CLOTHES HANGER
dialogues.text: SCREECHING as it's slid along a metal rack. Rachel is shopping for bargains, moving along racks of discarded clothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise, you've got too much great stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the back of the shop, laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it all, darlin'. Frank leans casually against a wall, not watching Rachel, but watching the shop, watching the street outside. Rachel finds something she likes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wooo!   Let me try this on. She flicks a glance to Frank; he's not looking at her. She pulls back the curtain of the makeshift changing booth, then stops dramatically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Frank, indicating the open booth) Farmer, do you want to come in here with me? Just to be safe? Frank glances at her, then resumes his surveillance of the shop. Rachel's head bobs up and down above the curtain as she changes. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You probably won't believe this, but I have a reputation for being a bitch. Frank says nothing. He gazes outside through the store- front window and sees Henry and Tony horsing around next to the limo. A few small boys stand around the car. One of them is climbing onto the hood. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't used to be. But you get known for being a certain way -- a way people think you are -- and pretty soon you get like that. Can't help it. Frank smiles knowingly.   Rachel notices. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think so? You're such an expert on famous people? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen a few. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you disagree? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very flat) You can be as you choose to be. It's an act of discipline sometimes, but it can be done. Rachel stops in her tracks... then opens the curtains and looks at herself in the mirror. Also reflected in the mirror is Frank. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That why you never stay with one of your clients? They too undisciplined for you? Or is it you're afraid you'll start to care about them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without interest) That's right. Rachel turns to Frank. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you answer straight just once? Why don't you talk to me? I'm not such a bad lady. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're too clever for me.   I can't keep up. Frank continues to search the shop and street with his gaze. Rachel steps closer to him. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at me, Farmer! Frank turns and looks at her. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't approve of me, do you? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disapproval's a luxury I can't afford. Gets in the way. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't like emotions getting to you, huh? Never mix business with pleasure? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. It's a stand-off. After a moment, Rachel motions to an outfit on a rack just behind him. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grab that would you? Frank takes a beat.   Looks out the window. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here to keep you alive... not to help you shop. Fuming, Rachel sizes things up, then grabs it herself, whipping the curtain shut behind her. A smile plays across Frank's face.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: We see a man's hands remove a video cassette from its sleeve. The cover reads "RACHEL MARRON - THE #1 HITS." The CASSETTE is gently eased into the slot of the video player. Rachel's image appears on the screen, singing softly, intensely, passionately into the camera. WE TRACK INTO the image, as if a little hypnotized by it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank sits alone in his room, lit by the glow of the TV, dressed in a business-style blue suit and tie. He's watching Rachel's videos. Scattered around the video player are a collection of other Rachel Marron CD's, tapes and videos. Frank has been noting down lyrics on the yellow legal pad on his lap. Some of the phrases are circled. As he watches, we see a subtle change in his expression. It is as if he really were looking at Rachel for the firs time, here, watching her sing. For a second, she seems to be singing to him alone, passionate and vulnerable. He opens a small box and removes a tiny enamelled Russian Orthodox-type cross. He fastens the clasp, checking that it holds, then looks back to the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel's SONG PLAYS OVER the moonlit estate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is surprisingly bare and simple, almost empty apart from Rachel's collection of old and faded dolls on the shelves and on the bed. Rachel is getting dressed for the evening. A hairdresser stands behind her, fussing with her hair. Rachel hears the MUSIC coming from outside and moves to the window. (The hairdresser moves with her, still busy with the brush.) Gazing across the garden, she sees the light in Frank's room and hears her own voice singing out from there too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank is showing Henry how to check the underside of the limo with an angled mirror on a stick. Both are crouched beside the vehicle. A noise makes them look up. Rachel, dressed to the nines and looking very sexy, emerges from the house with Spector and Devaney. Spector's carrying a videotape. Tony follows as they head for the car, where

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Henry are waiting. Fletcher stands in the doorway, flanked by uniformed security guards. He waves at Frank. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Henry) I thought it was dinner. Henry shrugs. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Spector) Are we going somewhere else? SPECTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mayan, Frank. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the Mayan? Spector starts to climb into the limo. SPECTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a club, Frank. Come on, Henry, let's go. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spector, you've got to tell me about these things. SPECTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just did. He disappears inside the limo. Rachel tugs at Frank's lapels, looks him up and down, brushing something off his shoulder. Frank's annoyed. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice suit, Frank. Rachel is about to get in. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel. He removes something from his pocket, a small enameled cross. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to keep this. Rachel looks at it, both flattered and confused. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For me?   It's beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fitted with a radio transmitter. When you close the clasp, it sends a signal. If there's ever a problem and we're separated, just press it and I'll know you need me. Rachel doesn't know how to respond. She's stuck for words. Spector pokes his head out impatiently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, she knows how it works, let's get going. Rachel manages a quick smile to Frank as she gets in the back. Frank gets in the front beside Tony. The limo pulls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank rides beside Tony in the front seat. The RADIO PLAYS SOFTLY in the b.g. In back, Rachel, Spector and Devaney are drinking champagne. Tony burps, smiles at Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're listening to K.R.O.K., the rock of L.A. and yes we have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We told you we'd crack the case of the mystery guest... and if you are one of the few who hasn't heard, it's Rachel at the Mayan. Franks turns UP the VOLUME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel Marron, tonight, appearing as Billy Thomas' very special guest. But if you don't have a ticket, you can forget going down there. Police are asking us to ask you to stay away. So everybody, please stay cool, stay tuned and we'll try to get you some interviews after the show. Remember, you heard it here on K.R.O.K. -- the station that delivers. Frank looks back at Spector who silently mouths --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't me. The car turns a corner and there it is, The Mayan only fifty yards ahead, a mob of fans spilling out of the club, off the sidewalk and into the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' a. Spector whoops with uncontrolled delight from the back of the limo. Frank stares ahead in disbelief. The NOISE of the CROWD can be heard as they pull up front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mob reacts to the sight of the approaching limo which turns into the parking area and heads for the backstage. Faces of the fans are at the windows leering at Rachel. Many are grotesquely painted. Some go into a wild frenzy as Rachel's limo pulls up. There is a punch-up and a man is beaten back. Someone has a video camera. Its quartz light shines in through the limo windows. Everybody squints at the glare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Rachel's car pulls up, the beaten man dances weirdly at the curb with blood streaming from his nose. A pair of security guards try to hold them back.    As he limo stops, a chant begins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel!   Rachel! We want Rachel! Others join in as the mob presses forward. The instant she exits the car, her expression goes public -- a wide, show-biz smile. Sandwiched between Spector and Devaney, with Tony in front and Frank at the rear, Rachel makes her entrance. A young man breaks the barrier   moving toward Rachel. Frank grabs him by one of his   belt loops, gracefully guides him all the way across   and slips him under the opposite cordon into the arms   of a security guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel steps into a room set for a star's arrival. Flowers are on every surface that will hold them. One huge arrangement is so big it has to be placed on the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: floor. Frank checks them all with a magnometer wand before letting Rachel sit down. He goes out, closing the door, watchful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank's eyes search the crush of people, milling around outside the dressing room. A few feet away, Spector talks to a JOURNALIST who's carrying a tape recorder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and this is my exclusive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear I thought she'd talk to you. Maybe later. What can I say. Frank is checked out by a strange-looking women in Vampyra Drag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel sits in front of the mirror putting on the silver headpiece we saw earlier. She notices a small spray of lilies-of-the-valley among the floral arrangements. An envelope marked "Rachel" is attached to it. She reaches forward and opens it. We see the note as she unfolds it.

dialogues.speaker: FOR DEATH
dialogues.text: We see the shock in her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spector, Frank, and Devaney are there. Rachel seems dazed, unfocussed. Devaney hands the note to Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sent another one. Rachel immediately picks up on this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean 'another one'? Frank quickly shoots a look at Spector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They didn't tell you.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Tell me what?

dialogues.speaker: DEVANEY
dialogues.text: There were some letters before, Rachel... same kind of thing, threats, oddball stuff...

dialogues.speaker: SPECTOR
dialogues.text: We didn't want to worry you...

dialogues.speaker: DEVANEY
dialogues.text: ... and somebody got into the house...

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (starting to panic) Someone was in my house?

dialogues.speaker: SPECTOR
dialogues.text: Okay.   Let's not get hysterical...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Let's get her out of here.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Someone was in my house?

dialogues.speaker: SPECTOR
dialogues.text: It was weeks ago. You were out of town...

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: While Fletcher was there?

dialogues.speaker: SPECTOR
dialogues.text: Listen, Fletcher is okay. The house is like Fort Knox now. Right, Frank?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: We should get her out of here. Right now!

dialogues.speaker: SPECTOR
dialogues.text: There's no way anyone could...

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: No way anyone could what?

dialogues.speaker: SPECTOR
dialogues.text: No, wait... look everybody calm down. Calm down.

dialogues.speaker: DEVANEY
dialogues.text: Sy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just see how she is. (to Rachel)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you feel, honey? Someone comes through the door with some flowers.   Frank eases them out and gently closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't protect her out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think he's out there? Devaney can't answer.   She turns to Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's here, isn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He might be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know that. Frank, we don't know that. Rachel is enraged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you know he was in my house... oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go home, Sy. We'll have to make an announcement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, you make it, they'll tear the fucking place apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lone mike stands onstage. The crowd's growing im- patient. A RHYTHMIC CLAPPING begins. Devaney walks timidly onstage. He's not happy to be there. He reaches the mike and taps it with a finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me... hello... I've got an announcement to make. I'm sorry but... due to circumstances beyond... Voices shout. "Where's Rachel?"... a groan begins. A chorus of boos fills the room. He raises his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More voices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
