dialogues.text: Frank guides Rachel toward the stage exit. A roar from the audience begins. "Rachel! Rachel! Rachel!" It grows louder as they near the exit. Rachel's expression is a combination of fear and humiliation. When they have almost reached the exit, she stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel... don't do it.    It's not worth it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting him off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No fucking freak is gonna chase me off stage. She pulls away from him.    Farmer starts after her, clos followed by Spector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid that... A great gush of applause from the audience. Devaney's befuddled. He doesn't see Rachel walking up behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel won't be able... Rachel stands beside him beaming. She bows. Claps back to her fans. Devaney retreats. Rachel gestures in his direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill Devaney, ladies and gentlemen, thank you, Bill. Hey, everyone. Hello! Isn't Billy Thomas the greatest. He's asked me to sing a song. I hope you don't mind. The crowd roars its approval. Frank nervously scans the room. Rachel smiles and moves along the stage. MUSIC starts in the b.g. Masking obvious fear, she starts to sing. As she takes one hand from the microphone, her fingers tremble. She clasps it again to hide her anxiety.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: shows her alone and vulnerable, bathed in light, center- stage. Rachel snatches a quick glance at Frank then looks back to her silent audience.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: He scans the audience intensely, face to face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel's limo stands waiting. CAMERA PULLS BACK to reveal a black Toyota 4 X 4 parked among the other cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel approaches the end of her song, her voice coming ever stronger. Spector comes up to Frank in the wings, positioning himself combatively between Frank and his view of Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we having a communications problem here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Spector's presence is a distraction. Frank steps to one side for a better view of Rachel. Spector moves too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apparently, I didn't make it clear to you how things go around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told me you were going to tell her. And you didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't think she could handle it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she handled it fine. Frank continues to peer past Spector's shoulder, his vigilance undiminished. Soothed and nurtured by the obvious admiration of her audience, Rachel's fear is beginning to vanish. The song is taking over. Spector changes tack, becoming confidential, "man-to-man."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look. Frank, I know what you're saying. I know you want to do what's best for her. I understand that. You have a job to do here. But you have to understand that Rachel has a job to do too. And that's what she's doing - out there. She's working, Frank. That's what she does and that's where she does it. She's hot right now. This is the time for her. If she doesn't get out there, she's dead. Forget about crazy death threats, if she doesn't sing, she's dead anyway... Look, handled properly, this thing could be good for a million dollars' worth of free publicity. Frank grabs him by the collar and slams him up against a wall of curtain ropes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could clinch her the nomination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One word in print about any of this... Spector nods, half-gasping. Frank tightens his grip. Frank's attention is drawn by a renewed roar from the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trouble with you is you don't understand the sympathy vote.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel scans the crowd, spread before her like a surreal mural. Camera flashbulbs explode like crazy through the glare. The thundering adoration is like a stimulant. She darts a look to Frank and gives him a fierce "naughty girl" smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning back to crowd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like that? Would like to hear another? Billy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the wings, Billy Thomas gives her the nod to go for it. It seems to be alright with everyone. The band starts playing a dance beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the prowl)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think my feet are trying to tell me something... wanna see a new video? The crowd explodes. They know what song is coming. They start to move with Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dancing, talking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to dance... She skitters to the other side of the stage, baiting her fans. Her new video explodes across the video wall behind her. The crowd surges forward. Two security guards nervously tense up, watching the crowd. When one fan tries to climb onstage, Frank reaches out and unbalances him, so that the man falls back into the audience. Another man climbs the stage on the other side. One of the guards darts out like a ballboy at a tennis match, pushes the fan back and scurries to the far side to resume his vigilance. The crowd is getting even more excited, pressing closer, trying to touch Rachel. The security guards move in, but Rachel gestures for them to back off.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Frank's task has suddenly become impossible. A forest of hands and faces start to engulf Rachel. Anyone could be the killer. Frank's eyes  dart over them all, his gaze intense, as if trying to hold them off by sheer willpower

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking offstage at Frank. His frustration is almost intoxicating to her. She struts over the lip of the stage. A man leaps up from audience to join her. Frank starts forward. Rachel gestures to him to hold back, waving him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spector stands well out of Frank's reach, staring at Rach onstage. He catches Frank's attention, yelling back defiantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at her, fucking great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel dances erotically with the man -- bumping and grinding, sinking to her knees. The crowd roars approval. Frank quickly sizes up the scene. He speaks into a SURV KIT microphone in his sleeve. Across the room we see Henry listening, pushing an earpiece to his ear. Henry quickly scurries to an exit. Frank starts moving toward the stage. At that moment, the lucky man Rachel's dancing with grabs her around the waist and spins her gleefully, like the dance partner she has been pretending to be. One of security guards rushes forward to extri- cate her. The spinning man inadvertently bumps hard into the guard and the man loses his grip on Rachel. She flies out of his grasp and tumbles off the front of the stage -- into the adoring arms of a half dozen fans. The audience goes wild. This is the kind of thing Rachel was famous for when she was starting out. The scene resembles a rugby scrum... with Rachel the ball. Frank sees Rachel being passed over the heads of fans -- deeper into the audience. Her dress is ripped and torn apart. The silver headpiece is dislodged and disappears into the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Fear fills her face. She's gone over the edge, literally and figuratively. She's lost control. Tony and the security guards are fighting to get to her, slamming bodies out of the way. In the b.g., the video continues on its serene, uninterrupted way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He spots a fire extinguisher in the wings.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Frank grabs it and heads to center stage. He aims the extinguisher at the crowd between Rachel and the stage. The chemical foam does its job, scattering fans. Frank leaps onto the floor, kicking a wild-eyed young blond man in the chest as he fights his way to Rachel, taking her in his arms. Tony runs ahead of Frank, knocks a fan off the stage and waves for Frank to follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony, not there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take care of this. He heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just follow me. He turns and heads out to the sidewalk like a bull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony bursts out the front door and begins cutting a swath through the crowd. Rain beats down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make way here. Outta the way! A burly street regular gets a shove from Tony and comes back hard. The  crowd immediately sides with him, yells encouragement.  But Tony is the better man and sends him sprawling. The  rest of the way to the curb opens up. At the parking area Tony discovers there is no limo and turns in bewilderment to Rachel. But she is not there. A couple of people laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel and Frank emerge from the darkness between two garbage bins and get into the limo Henry has waiting ther The car moves out with a SCREECH of tires, narrowly missi Spector as he staggers out of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! What the fuck... Farmer! Farmer! Come back here... The limo skids around the corner and speeds off up the street, leaving Spector in helpless fury -- apoplectic an speechless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank turns and looks at Rachel.    She is diminutive, doll-like, alone in the center of   the large limousine seat. Her  hands rise to her face   and her body begins t shake with sobs as she sits there   alone in the tattered remains of her dress. Frank turns away to avoid staring at her, but he feels

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: uncomfortable.   Henry senses what is going on and speaks softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never done that before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been a long night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd is thinning out. A dim worklight is burning somewhere backstage. The auditorium is a mess; the cleaning crew has begun to work on the debris from the riot. FOOTSTEPS APPROACH, walking, pausing, as if looking for something. Lying on the floor in big CLOSEUP we see a small  fragmen of Rachel's dress. The FOOTSTEPS STOP by it. A    hand picks it up gently and lifts it OUT OF FRAME. We   hear t sound of a deep lingering INHALATION of breath.   The fee move on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher is asleep in his bed. Frank waits as Rachel glances in. Then she moves away. Opening the door to her room, she steps back, allowing him to enter ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank moves quickly into the room, checking the window and French door. Rachel waits silently by the door. All is clear. He steps back to the door. As he approaches her she begins to tremble. He gently reaches out and takes her in his arms. Slowly holding her he leads her to bed, moving aside some of Rachel's dolls, laid out on the pillows. Her hands go automatically to her dress but they are shaking so badly she cannot undo it. Frank gently does it for her. She willingly allows him to undress her and not a word is spoken between them. As she sits naked still trembling, he pulls down the covers and guides her gently into bed. As he adjusts the covers she reaches up and takes hold of his hand. He looks down, stroking her forehead like a child's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you going to ask me why I behave like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank sits alone at a table in the huge kitchen, care- fully cutting and eating a peach.  The door at the other end of the room slams open and Tony stalks in, soaking wet. He has just made his way home  from the MAYAN and he is boiling. He sights on Frank and  moves toward him fast Frank just watches until Tony is almost upon him. As Tony reaches out to lift him by his shirt, Frank spins low out of his seat. Tony's legs are knocked out from under him. He lands hard on his back and finds himself looking up at Frank, who holds him down with the chair he was sitting on, like a lion tamer, a leg strut pressed against Tony's throat. Frank looks down at him question- ingly, as if to ask, "Had enough?" Tony scowls and nods. Frank lifts the chair away. Tony stands up and faces him. Frank turns away and Tony throws a punch at his head, barely catching him as Frank ducks and moves in under it. He hits Tony twice and throws him against a cabinet. Tony gets up slowly, looks around and grabs a carving knife from a hook on the wall. He holds it in front of him threateningly. Frank shakes his head. He's getting irritated. He picks up the knife he's been using on the peach and flips it in his hand so he's holding it by the blade. With the same fluid motion we've seen earlier, he throws it at Tony. It sticks in the wall an inch from Tony's ear. Tony does a slow take and then lowers his blade. Frank picks up his dirty dish and takes it to the sink. He glances at Tony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to talk about this again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank has been talking to the uniformed guard in the gate house and now begins walking up the drive toward the man- sion. The grounds are quiet, beautiful, misty. We see him from behind some foliage, as if he's being covertly observed, stalked. A twig snaps and he turns sharply. It's Rachel. She's dressed in a soft jumpsuit and starts jogging out from behind the bushes towards him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The suit softens her appearance; she looks lovely. Her manner, too, has altered; she is charming -- friendly and very girlish. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!   Gotcha, didn't I? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're probably wondering what I'm doing. (as Frank nods) You didn't know I jogged, did you? Frank shakes his head. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter? 'Fraid I'll get picked off in my snazzy running suit? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm afraid I'll have to jog with you. They both smile. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.    I guess I can't do it. Rachel stops pumping, gasps for air, and for one moment, rests a hand on Frank's arm to support herself. She removes it quickly. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you walk with me a little? Frank nods and they cut off across the grounds. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hard for her) I know this is kinda late, but thank you. I'm really glad you're here. (she looks at him) I'm going to try to cooperate. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would be good. They walk in silence for few moments. When Rachel finally speaks, she sounds genuinely unsure of herself, nervous. It's very appealing. And if it's an act, she's a terrific actress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farmer... I have this problem. This minor little problem. You see, I'd like to go out for an evening. Just me and a guy. You know... (makes a funny face)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... like a 'date.' But I can't go out on a date because you have to be with me every minute. I mean, what if he invited me up to his place afterwards? Are you going to come, too? (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So the only thing I can figure is for you to take me out. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... that's what I was wondering ... you know. What do you think? But only if you want to. Frank is bemused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only if you want to... I'm not so bad... (looks at him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, this is embarrassing. I'm gonna run up ahead there. You decide. She runs up the hill to the pool area, which is now above them. He walks up after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicki is yelling from a window on the second floor of the mansion. Fletcher peers out with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel!    Sandy Harris is on the phone! Rachel and Frank look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her she'll have to wait, babe. I'm getting fixed up here.

dialogues.speaker: AT WINDOW
dialogues.text: She watches Frank and Rachel, her expression neutral. She turns away. Fletcher continues to watch his mother with Frank.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The SOUND is DEAFENING. A wet car comes out of the tunnel of machinery. In the distance, glimpsed through the spinning brushes, Henry talks to a couple of workers as he waits for the limo to be cleaned. Hands appear with a large chamois cloth, moving easily and fast over the hood and windshield. A black in his early twenties is finishing the exterior of the car. A second pair of hands appear.    White hands in rubber gloves. They open the  driver's   door and push a vacuum suction hose inside.  The hands   switch ON the car RADIO loud. Loud enough to  hear over   the din outside the car The hose works its way over the   front seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And here's another biggie from a lady very much in the news these days, Miss Rachel Marron... We see the owner of the hands. It is the young blond man Frank kicked aside at the MAYAN. His name is DAN. His face is impassive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... the hit song from the movie... Queen Of The Night... I Have Nothing. The song begins and Rachel's voice fights the din. In the back of the car, Dan's hose probes around, nosing into all the crevices of the upholstery. It sucks up a crumpled pre-signed photograph of Rachel from the gap beside the rear seat. The hose is switched off and the gloved hands retrieve the picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tight, shabby facilities. Dan opens the combination padlock to his locker and deposits the crumpled photo inside. As the hands remove the rubber gloves, the inside of the locker is revealed. Pasted over every inch of the locker are pictures of Rachel Marron. One tabloid shot of her dancing with the word "whore" scrawled across it. Taped to a single sheet of white paper in the center, like a holy relic, is the torn scrap of Rachel's dress from the MAYAN. The hands pin up the newly-acquired photo next to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Special Agent Court is seated next to a white-coated technician. The technician is leaning over one of the neatly pasted-up death threats we have seen earlier. With a scalpel, he lifts the word "whore" from out of the message. He sets it on a white sheet, then brings the blade back and scrapes at the residue of the dry glue on the letter. INSERT - B&W SHOT OF TOSHIRO MIFUNE WIELDING HIS SWOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Rachel exit with a small crowd.    Rachel wears scarf and tinted glasses. The combination    goes a long way toward disguising her. They pause at    one of the di play windows. Inside is a poster for the    movie, Yojimb a large picture of Toshiro Mifune looking   scruffy and fierce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he didn't look like he wanted to die to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a big difference between wanting to die and having no fear of death. They walk down the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And because he had no fear of death, he was invincible?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he sure creamed 'em all in the end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it was a good movie. They walk off down the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many times have you seen it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixty-two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a bit of a dive, but the food is good and the atmos- phere is great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your kinda place? Frank nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your kinda music? As she smiles:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You figure no one can get by you here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If someone is willing to swap his life for a kill, nothing can stop him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.   What do I need you for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He might get me instead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're ready to die for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my job. Rachel looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you'd do it? Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't sing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe there's some glory in saving a president or something, but just anyone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean like you?    It's a matter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of conditioning and discipline. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't trust discipline. At the crucial moment I'd cop out. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That happens. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But not with you, Fierce Frank. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It happens. A beat. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever liked anybody? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like me -- a girl. Frank knows what she's driving at. But he's not at all happy to relinquish this information. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long time ago. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? Do you mind if I ask? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you mind if I don't answer? RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to pry... Frank smiles at that. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (begins to laugh, can't help herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't die did she? You weren't like... protecting her and she got killed? Frank is silent, grim.    Rachel looks stricken. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my god!    That's it, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody's perfect. Rachel is taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Frank, I'm sorry. Frank laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... Nice try though. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was less dramatic than that. She didn't love me anymore. Can you imagine such a thing? Frank puts a smiling spin on this last; it's pretty charming. Rachel looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not really. A SONG comes on the JUKEBOX -- 'WHAT BECOMES OF THE BROKE HEARTED.' Frank smiles as Rachel begins to sing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, is this a full service date, Frank? Frank's wary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just asking you to dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Rachel navigate a tiny dance floor. Frank is a surprisingly good dancer and is comfortable being this close to her. Rachel hums softly, picking up the words to the song.   A we listen to the lyrics something clicks in her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. A beat, then Rachel bursts out laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reddening)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to compose herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry... It's just that... It's so depressing. Now they're both laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is, isn't it. Suddenly a dish drops to the floor. Frank, still dancing, makes a smooth quick turn that puts his body between Rachel and the noise. His head turns to locate the source of the noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, I'll protect you. They drift back into the music, Rachel singing, Frank watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank's car is parked in the driveway.    A light goes on in a basement window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank hangs back, drink in hand, as Rachel explores the basement. Frank has fitted it out as a combination gym/ target range/weapons workshop. The place has a kind of unfussy order about it, a simplicity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's very quiet here. She walks to some shelves -- a random selection of books, football and karate trophies, framed citations and other memorabilia. She glances at a dusty framed photo of a football team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West Virginia University Football. God, look at you. She looks at Frank, quizzically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you play?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: End. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you tough? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.    Fast. Rachel puts down her drink and moves toward a samurai sword that is mounted in its scabbard on the wall. She looks at it, peering closely. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You some kind of a samurai, too? Frank smiles. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They said you were in the Secret Service. What made you get out? Frank moves away and sits on a sofa against the wall. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Money. Rachel looks around at Frank's modest home. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see your tastes are extravagant. She looks at Frank and then back at the sword.   She reaches out to touch it. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I? Frank nods. Rachel takes it off its mount carefully, unhooks the scabbard and begins to slide it off. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch yourself. Rachel slides the scabbard off. The naked blade is breathtaking. Rachel holds the sword out before her. She walks toward Frank, then stops and looks over the blade at him. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a hard one to figure, Frank Farmer. He stares at her. She steps closer, so the blade is only about a foot from his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seems to me a bodyguard must know little peace. Frank stands up so that the point of the sword is only about an inch from his chest. He reaches out over the blade to Rachel's neck and unties the silk scarf she is wearing there. One hand draws the scarf away. The other hand lingers for a moment on her neck, then lifts away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch this. He has raised the scarf over his head, in   the space between them. With two hands he spreads    it out and the lets it go. Slowly, billowing, the scarf    floats down over the blade and is cut in two. These    two pieces flo slowly to the floor. Frank takes Rachel's wrist and moves the sword away to the side. They are both holding it as Rachel presses her body against Frank's and they begin to kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their lovemaking is INTERCUT with SLOW MOTION black and white images of Samurai warriors from the movie, Yojimbo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They lie nude under a sheet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never been this safe before. Frank smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one could get by you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now it might not be so hard. Rachel laughs, kisses him and buries her head down into his shoulder. Frank stares across the bed at the samurai sword lying on the floor. Some of Rachel's clothing is draped in a heap across it. The torn pieces of her scarf lie nearby. HOLD ON Frank's look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The roller-blind is raised with a sharp, snapping sound. Frank is moving around the room, getting dressed. Rachel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is still in the bed behind him, woken by the noise of his activity. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What is it? What are you doing? Frank keeps moving, looking for his shoes. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel, I don't want to get confused about what I'm doing here. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not confused. Frank finds his shoes. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You pay me to protect you, that's what I do. Rachel sits up. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Have I done something wrong? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, nothing. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what is it? She lifts the sheet seductively and looks over the top of it. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want me to beg? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I want you to do without. She stops. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on, Frank? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to keep it straight in my head what job I'm doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what is that exactly?    Making me feel like shit? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm sorry. This is my fault. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't apologize for godsake. Just tell me what I did. I'm a big girl. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't do anything. It was me. I involved myself with my client. Rachel picks up on the word. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your "client"? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made a mistake. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What mistake?... You don't find me attractive anymore. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ! I've told you why. I can't protect you like this. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what?   That's it for me? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it. He automatically checks the gun as he slips it into the holster. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can live with that or you can fire me. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I can't fuck you. Frank turns and looks at her.    This is hard for him, to RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe this... I'm asking you?... Let me tell you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops suddenly and, with a roar of combined frus- tration, humiliation and rage, she lurches from the bed in search of her clothes. Frank shuts his eyes in morti- fication and pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nanny sits in the early morning mist, embroidering. Frank is kneeling with Fletcher beside the pool. He's putting new batteries into Fletcher's boat. Fletcher watches him as he tears off the wrapping from the batteries, much preoccupied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (watching him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's real mad at you, isn't she? Frank stops what he's doing and just looks blankly at the batteries in his hands. There's a beat of silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She told me she doesn't understand why you're so shitty to her... Frank's shoulders droop and he lets out an imperceptible sigh. He gently resumes fitting the batteries, still not looking at Fletcher. In the quiet of early morning, it's almost like a confessional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've spent a lot of time learning not to react to things like other people do. It's my job. But it doesn't always work, Fletcher... it doesn't always work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm an old man compared to you, pal, and I don't understand either. And I'm starting to get the feeling I never will. There's a crunch of footsteps behind him.       He looks around. With a big flourish, a copy of Daily Variety is put down in front of us, front page upwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ta Da!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank takes in that it's Nicki then glances at Variety, lying on the concrete beside him. Splashed across the top, the headlines announce the day's news of the Academy Award nominations. Rachel's name is among the Best Actress nominees. The Hollywood Reporter follows. Frank picks up Variety and stares at it. Nicki stands beside him with the morning's mail under her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought you'd like to know. Everyone said she was a sure thing. Of course, you know all about that. She raises an eyebrow, gives him a look. Frank looks steadily back at her. She drops a small pile of mail beside the magazines... several letters and a small packet. She's embarrassed by Frank's gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. That was out of line. It's none of my business... Here's today's question marks for you. She turns and walks briskly back to the house. Frank watches her go, then looks slowly down to the pile. From across the pool, Fletcher watches silently, then pushes his boat out into the deep water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank is investigating the small packet, with a surgeon's precision, checking it with a stethoscope and a metal detector, sniffing at it. It has been addressed in the normal way, except that Rachel's name has been cut out of a magazine and pasted above the address. He begins carefully slicing away the wrapping. Inside is a cardboard box. The contents are still hidden by packing paper. He picks it away with tweezers. Suddenly there is a LOUD BUZZING from the box and movement in the paper. Frank drops the box into a bed of sand in a sink surrounded by sandbags. The movement slows and stops. Frank extracts the item -- it is a wind-up mechanical beaver with a hand-painted sign hung around its neck: WE LOVE YOU, RACHEL YOUR FANS IN BEAVER, PA. SALLY AND KATE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beaver's TEETH CLICK in Frank's hand. We see Frank's face. This may just have taken years off his life. He holds his hand out straight, palm downwards,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and looks at it.   No tremor.   Just checking. Spector's voice suddenly shouts from the next door office

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farmer!   Get in here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The office is filled with congratulatory balloons and flowers heralding the morning's news. Spector's secretary is taking congratulatory phone messages at a desk in the b.g. Two assistants are struggling in through the door with a large basketed floral arrangement. Spector confronts Frank across his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put together a list of   your expenses. Your total    billing... Let me have it in one   hour and I'll see that a check   is cut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you ever say what's on your mind? Spector cannot believe he's being so addressed -- especially in front the staff. The assistants stop in their tracks and look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost shouts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's on my mind is that you're fired, Frank. She missed all her interviews yesterday because of your little date. Do you realize she stood up Barbara Walters? First you fuck up her career... Behind Spector, out of his line of sight, Rachel and Devaney appear in the doorway with more cards. They also stop and listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and now you're fucking with her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's between us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think so? You forget who signs your check. You don't understand the role I play around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   I understand. Spector stiffens, then decides not to take this one on. SPECTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your shit together and be out of here by noon. DEVANEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank stays. Spector looks round, sees that Devaney and Rachel have been listening. Rachel is silent. With a curt nod of his head, Spector gestures to the assistants to leave the room. Devaney weighs in. DEVANEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With this high a profile, Rachel needs protection now more than ever. If he goes, you can forget Miami... SPECTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's signed the fucking contract, Bill. You want me to read it to you? Rachel is watching them both. DEVANEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck the contract. If he goes, she's not singing a note. It's too dangerous. SPECTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. 'Fuck the contract.' Great. Why don't you let Rachel speak for herself? I think she has some say in this. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flatly) Frank stays. Spector considers her for a beat, then looks at the other The secretary interrupts from the back of the office. SECRETARY (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Schiller calling on line one... Spector ignores her, still holding his look at Devaney, Rachel and Frank. SPECTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I guess this is democracy in action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel nods. Spector, turning to take the call, flashes her a "little boy" look. SPECTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gave in. That's not easy for me. Don't I get a hug? Rachel is stone-faced.   Spector covers by picking up the phone. SPECTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Yeah?... Sure, put him on... Ben how are you?... uh huh... Frank and Rachel look at each other in silence. SPECTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...The Ambassador? What the hell are you trying to pull, Ben? Rachel always gets the Presidential... I don't care what you thought... Devaney leans to Frank as Spector's conversation continue in the b.g. DEVANEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know the Fontainebleau Hotel in Miami Beach? Frank nods. DEVANEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does the Ambassador Suite compare to the Presidential for us? Frank thinks only for a moment. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's on the twentieth    floor in the south wing. There's a     service elevator right there.     Mainly ocean windows. Should     be no problem. SPECTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) ... I'm aware of that, Ben, but let me just remind you people that you invited us... Frank turns toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Frank)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang around, Farmer. We might need your vaunted expertise. She reaches forward and hits a button on Spector's desk, throwing the call onto a speaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sweetly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Ben honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel, congratulations, you must be thrilled at the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (across him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben. I hear you've got me in the annex next to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We COME STREAKING IN OVER the ocean TOWARD the towering white Fontainebleau. ON the SOUNDTRACK, we hear JOHN TESH'S VOICE filling the viewers in on the latest Hollywood dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...It's off to Sun City today for Best Actress nominee Rachel Marron. Rachel's giving two AIDS charity concerts this week at Miami's Fontainebleau Hotel. A thousand a plate no less. And rumor has it that the lovely lady has unseated the governor of Florida himself. Seems there was a showdown on who'll get to lounge in that big Fontainebleau penthouse tonight. As we CIRCLE the top floor, we see a tiny figure on the balcony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, sleep tight in the Presidential Suite, Rachel. Who says a nomination isn't as good as winning...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank looks up at the disappearing helicopter then down

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: over the edge and around the corner. He leans slightly against the wrought iron railing. It sways precariously. Frank catches himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thuringer. Frank kneels and inspects the fixture that anchors it to the cement balcony: the cement crumbles around it, a weld joint is broken on the side. THURINGER, the hotel security chief, joins Frank on the balcony. Frank shakes the railing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God damn.    I'll get someone right on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank walks quickly across the living  room of the lavish suite.  Two uniformed security guards  are making a sweep of the room with POLICE DOGS. Frank   checks the drawer o a side table and then seals it with a  peel-off security tape.  Thuringer is waiting near the  entrance hall. Frank nods to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.   Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a semi-private corridor; several hotel employees are steam-cleaning the carpet. Frank looks at them, then Thuringer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, they've been cleared. He shows his clipboard to Frank. As the two men walk along the corridor, the guest elevator opens and a twelve-year-old boy in a bathing suit (MARK KATZ) steps out, accompanied by his nanny. In the background, hotel security men are checking fire-extinguishers and closets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Frank)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Katzes of St. Louis. Very prominent. Come every year. An elderly couple and three grandchildren. A nurse and a maid. They pass the little boy as he reaches the door of the Katz suite with his nanny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Frank smiles and nods to the nanny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Frank)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theirs is the only suite on the floor. The two men reach the service elevator and the emergency exit door at the end of the hall. Frank opens the stair- way door and goes inside. Thuringer follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you asked, the rooms below have been kept vacant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doorway closes behind the two men. Frank tries it; it's locked. They continue down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Thuringer walk into and along the edge of the busy kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank walks ahead of Thuringer. He looks around and pauses at the edge of the stage. Then he steps out on a stage. A piano tuner is at work in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as he looks out at the mammoth room. Frank stands center stage and looks around. The naked- ess of this spot gets to him. He shakes his head and looks at Thuringer. Thuringer smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a silly job this is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the glass doors that lead to the pool, bright quartz lights clock on. A camera crew stands waiting. Someone mimes a "we're rolling" sign with his hands. Inside Rachel waits with Spector and BEN SCHILLER, the tough, fat fellow who owns the place. Frank is at her elbow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O.K. Rachel. It's showtime! They're rolling. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this really necessary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.   It is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quit bitching, Farmer. This is the part you do get paid for. Rachel sweeps out the door.    The camera crew hurries to keep up with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place is crowded with hundreds   of guests basking o chaise lounges. A sea of sun-baked    faces virtually as far as the eye can see. The sight    of the crowd and the presence of the news crew seems to   push Rachel to a whole new adrenaline level. Rachel walks among them, moving swiftly, evaluating the bodies displayed before her in words and expressions, playing to the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. Look what they're wearing. Mother, hide your eyes... Heads turn to look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't wear that suit... Honey, you're naked... Of course, if I had a body like that... There is a murmur of recognition from some of the guests. She pauses to shake a hand, and now all the guests throughout the pool area are aware that Rachel Marron is among them. People stand on chairs, scramble for pens and paper, run

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: to get a closer look. Lounges collapse, drink GLASSES are BROKEN, flower tubs are trampled. A lot of pushing and shoving starts - too much for the video crew, who abandon the filming attempt. SPECTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, babe. They got what they needed. Let's get back inside. Frank increases his pace to keep by Rachel's side, gently easing a path for her. Schiller scurries behind in Frank's wake. Rachel turns suddenly as a tall good-looking lifeguard appears in the throng. She eyes him appreciatively. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to lifeguard) You look like a man of good taste to me. Come to my party tonight. (to Schiller) Ben, make sure this boy gets to my party. Schiller nods. Rachel glances at Frank, making sure he gets the point, and then she's off again. The throng gets tighter. Frank's having to work harder, steering her towards the door back into the hotel. The familiar chant starts up: "Rachel, Rachel." It's starting to resemble the frenzy of the opening scene. This time, amid the thrusting hands and clamoring faces, a few bewildered elderly guests look dazed as they are shoved forward. A child starts crying, lost in the mess of legs and Bermuda shorts. A distraught mother tries to reach him. Someone is jostled into the pool as the crowd surges again. Amid the chaos, whistles and scattered applause.   Rachel drinks it all in. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over her shoulder) Thank you. Thank you. Come tonight and give till it hurts. With a final surge, Frank makes it to the door with his party. The door closes shut behind them. A mass of distorted faces pushes onto the glass. The party walks on briskly. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Spector) I'm beginning to wonder about your judgement, Sy. Why do I have to keep paying my dues if I've already arrived?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very fast)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kick me, beat me... whatever makes you feel good. But let's not pretend you don't like it. We're too close for that. Whipping people into a frenzy is why you got into it in the first place. Rachel's eyes lock with  Spector's -- there's a real conn tion and understanding  here that she spends a lot of tim denying. Frank sees it   as clearly as Spector, whose ton becomes almost soothing  --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's nothing to be ashamed of, either, not for a second. It's a gift... and only a handful are given it. Many call but few are answered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fool with the blessing, Rachel. The magic is sustained through its use.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you're going to tell me about magic? Give it a rest will ya...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm done. Not another word... (a crooked smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I know you like to be reminded sometimes. Rachel looks away.   It's true.   He's good at his job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the spotlight, all alone, Rachel Marron works her magi She sings, as it was meant to be sung, "I Have Nothing." One person does not look at Rachel. He stands in a corner in front of the stage easily in the shadows. His eyes continually scanning. Picking up every movement. All alone. Watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fireworks explode over the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the living room, the first night party is in full swing. Crowded. Smoky. Noisy. Fireworks burst outside the windows. People clap. A mixed bag of upscale partygoers: women in party dresses, men in open shirts, etc. A black pianist is playing. Two bars at either end of the room. Waiters work the room with platters of canapes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony sits in a chair watching TV, a drink in his hand, oblivious to all. The lifeguard shuts Rachel's door be- hind him and makes his way down to the party. He pauses at the head of the stairs, checking out the party, and grabs a glass of champagne from a passing waiter. Frank catches the movement; the two men briefly lock eyes. The lifeguard responds with a knowing smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thuringer has set up a checkpoint through which all guests are passing. As they get off the elevator, they walk up to a desk manned by one of Thuringer's uniformed guards. When their names have been checked off a master list, they walk past another guard wielding a metal detector. No one likes it, but they all do it. Most of the local TV stations have sent camera crews. handheld cameras move among the guests, their bright lights flaring. FLASHBULBS POP. It's a local media event. Frank squints as a quartz light shines straight in his face. A tall, fit, athletic-looking man raises his arms; is cleared by the metal detector. He is GREG PORTMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Portman makes his way through the crowd to the bar. His eyes scan the suite. His gaze settles on Frank checking out the people who filter in. Portman appears next to Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Farmer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Portman. PORTMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buy you a drink? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orange juice. It's been awhile. You on the job? PORTMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) Technically I'm off duty,   but the Governor may show up here   later, so I thought I'd give it   a light check. (smiles) Someone else is covering   him right now. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old is she? PORTMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe eighteen. You working? Rachel makes her entrance, and poses self-mocking on the landing above the crowd, accepting applause. She has succeeded in under-dressing everyone in the room. She is a star. Frank nods in her direction... that's his client. PORTMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impressed) No kidding? I'd call that a step up from the President. Probably sings better too. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.   Thank you.   You're so right. SCATTERED LAUGHS. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want everyone to have a good time and drink as much of Ben Schiller's liquor as you like. Rachel descends into the crowd, laughing and blowing kisses. PORTMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Handful. Frank's look says if you only knew the half of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PORTMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard you had to take someone out in New York. Frank remembers. PORTMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lost track of you after the Reagan thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. PORTMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't your fault, Farmer. You weren't even there. A pause. PORTMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a call a couple of months ago. That guy you were covering in New York. He said you'd recommended me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprised?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little. FRANK (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never doubted your skills. PORTMAN (laughs, good- natured)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Only my qualifications for the priesthood. You were always clear about that. Anyway, I appreciate it. I had to turn it down but I appreciate it. Portman notices Rachel looking at him, as she makes her way to them. Rachel takes Frank's orange juice and sips. Makes a very funny face. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's orange juice! Rachel gives Portman an approving once-over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg Portman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I take it you've met my bodyguard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We used to work together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly more interested)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah... Well, well, well.    And what do you do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same thing as Farmer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking between them)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two samurai, eh? Frank and Portman eye each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Portman)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you working now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. (she takes his arm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'cause I'm the only one in the room who needs protection. She gives Frank a look and leads Portman into the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel's taking a breather on the balcony, drinking cham- pagne, talking to Portman and another couple. Everybody's high and happy. Conversation bubbles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel leans into Portman; heads together, they whisper intimately. Rachel laughs, then for a brief moment, turns her head to look directly at Frank. Her look is petulant, defiant. Portman does not see this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony helps himself to a handful of canapes, he turns at the sound of a COMMOTION out on the balcony. Someone's horsing around, spraying champagne from a bottle over everyone. A woman screams. Frank   bolts for the balcony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel and Portman are poised precariously halfway over the railing. Frank's hand shoots out, grabs Rachel's wrist and tugs at the pair of them. Portman regains his balance first and pulls Rachel back from the edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody tripped. It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at Portman)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God I had a bodyguard here. She grasps the railing and looks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Staring down twenty stories of distance between her and t pool area. Way, way below her, her champagne GLASS hits the tile with a MUFFLED SHATTERING sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a long way down, Frank. (to Portman)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saved my life. Frank eyes the newly-welded anchor fixture.   It has held. Rachel takes Portman by the arm.   The front of her dress is stained with champagne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe someone will keep an eye on me while I change. She leads Portman past Frank and up the stairs toward her bedroom. Frank and Portman lock eyes. Portman shrugs; he feels badly for Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank walks to the bar taking a drink from his glass. He looks in the mirror behind the bar and sees Rachel and Portman in the hall outside her bedroom. She turns her head to look directly at Frank's reflected face. Assured that Frank is watching, she takes Portman's hand and lead him into her room. Frank sets his glass down and the bartender refills it with orange juice. A stunning WOMAN IN GREEN glides down the bar and stands very close to Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been watching you all night from across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you go back there and keep watching? Frank looks at Rachel's doorway, sipping his juice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel and Portman are kissing, with some heat. Portman's hands are starting to explore her body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank still looks at Rachel's doorway, thinking. After a moment, he walks across the room to the sliding doors that lead to the balcony outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank steps outside. No one there. The moonlight re- flects off the ocean. The SURF sounds a STEADY BEAT. It is peaceful and quiet. A relief. On the Katz's balcony, forty feet away, little Mark Katz is leaning against the railing, staring at Rachel's suite. Frank smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to sleep. Frank looks out at the ocean. After a pause, in the background, Mark slips inside the Katz suite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel and Portman are still locked in the clinch. Realizing what she's doing, Rachel suddenly pulls back,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: catching herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not doing this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still holding her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you are. She steps out of his embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I was grateful.   Thank you and good night. She looks to the door that leads back to the party. The SOUNDS of CELEBRATION CONTINUE outside. She starts to cross to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cool)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please go now. Portman moves toward her as she opens the door, reaching for her arm. Then he sees, through the doorway, Tony standing in the hall talking to a woman. Tony looks up at the sound of the door and sees them both. Rachel slips quickly out of Portman's grip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Portman was just leaving us, Tony. Portman hesitates, then smiles at Rachel and Tony and, with a quick peck on Rachel's cheek, slips past them back to the party. Rachel briefly scans the party crowd over Tony's shoulder but she doesn't see Frank. The door closes, leaving her alone in the room again. She reaches for a bottle of Scotch and raises it to her mouth, drinking straight from the bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank looks out at the ocean. ECHOING on the soundtrack, we hear the song 'WHAT BECOMES OF THE BROKEN HEARTED' that Rachel and Frank danced to. It sounds slow and sweet and a long way away. Frank stares out at the ocean. Totally divorced from everything in the suite behind him, in the world around him. There is only the moon and the ocean. For this

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: one moment, his guard is down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chambermaid is Hoovering the floor. Rachel steps out of her bedroom. She looks terrible. Hungover, she is wearing sunglasses and a loose smock. It is noon of the following day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank is sitting at the kitchen table eating a sandwich. Behind him, in the dining room, a Cuban maid has set a place with breakfast. She is pouring orange juice as Rachel walks in. Rachel sits down at the table as though the walk in had been a terrible effort. She looks at the breakfast with distaste and picks up the coffee. Frank continues to eat. Rachel looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nasty) What the hell are you looking at? (pause) You probably never had a heavy night in your whole, goddamn disciplined life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank looks at her, continues to eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Farmer, you're a self- righteous son-of-a-bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank has to smile at this, which makes Rachel even angrier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't laugh at me, goddamit!   And don't you dare judge me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a break, will ya? I didn't tell you to fuck everybody in the hotel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Special  Agents Court and Minella are watching the genera manager  of the supply house as he pries the top off a hu canister  marked "INDUSTRIAL DETERGENT." The general manager  lifts the lid to reveal white powder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He talks animatedly and gestures around the warehouse. Court listens, nodding. Minella spoons some of the powder into a plastic bag and seals it. OVER this we hear Court's voice, filtered as on a telephone line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It matches the traces in the glue, Frank. We're getting to him. We're gonna nail this fucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank is on the courtesy phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, don't take too long, Ray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Frank.   It's good money, isn't it? Frank hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The elevator door opens and  Frank steps out. He walks toward the entrance to  the suite and is immediately alarmed by what  he sees: there is no uniformed guard by the front  door. He unlocks the door and goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank comes in and looks around quickly.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Looking over living room, hallways, balcony.    No one in sight. Nothing disturbed. Devaney comes out of Rachel's bedroom, a panicked look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: They face each other across the gulf of the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she? Where's Tony?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I thought you were with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank is at the telephone; he punches out three numbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thuringer, this is Farmer. Where's your man on the door to the suite? (listens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well get someone up here. Frank hangs up the phone, looks at Devaney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't know. They look at each other, worried. Frank walks out onto the balcony, looks round and down, comes back in. He heads for the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank is almost at the door. We hear LAUGHTER. A key turns in the lock. Rachel and Tony come through the door in high spirits, their arms full of shopping bags and packages. Frank stops dead and    watches. Rachel glances at him an goes into the living    room. Tony looks at him meaning- fully and follows.     Frank reflects for a moment, then pulls the front door    closed, oh so gently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel drops packages around and goes to the bar, pours herself a drink. Tony takes some packages to Rachel's bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Devaney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel, where the hell have you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony and I went over to Bal Harbour. Did a little shopping. Tony comes back, a smile playing across his lips.    Fran watches near the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were worried. (looks at Frank, talks to Rachel)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know you're not supposed to do that. Frank and Rachel look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farmer, you work here! Do you understand that? You work for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel. Frank turns and heads for the door.    Devaney looks at him anxiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farmer, where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna check the route.    As usual. He opens the front door. A uniformed guard is standing outside. Frank goes out and closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did Fletcher call? Devaney, staring after Frank, shakes his head "no."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank's face shows the tension and the anger.    The ele- vator descends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank walks along the edge of the kitchen, looks over the workers. A kitchen worker is in Frank's path. He looks up, sees Frank's face and scurries out of his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank walks along checking the corridor.        At each d way, he stops, looks inside. One room is dark. He flicks on the light. Near the door is a pile of wooden crates, placed unnaturally out from the wall.  Frank walks over and looks inside. They are discarded vegetable crates. Frank goes back to the door and yells toward the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gomez!   Louis Gomez! He waits impatiently. No one comes. Two quick steps and he is back at the CRATES, throwing them violently into the corner where they CLATTER loudly to the floor. Frank walks on along the corridor. He stops, noticing something around the side. He investigates. An ENORMOUS CUBAN is sitting on some boxes in the shadows. He doesn't bat an eye when he sees Frank. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? ENORMOUS CUBAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is none of you fuckin' business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move it. The Enormous Cuban gets slowly up from the boxes. towers over Frank. ENORMOUS CUBAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shove it up you ass, motherfucker. Frank has had   enough for one      afternoon. He hits th Cuban low and   hard. The man       crumples forward, hur but manages to   enfold Frank      in an awesome bear hug weight carries   them backward      in Frank's direction. The Cuban continues      moving in that direction, but Fr is no longer in his      grasp. Instead, incredibly, Fran seems to have passed      through the man's body and flic him into the corner      of the stairwell. The Cuban hits the wall hard. Jarred but not lost, he comes up and out wielding a long mop as if it were a baseball bat. Frank steps in and      under the man's long arms and hit four times around      the chest and jaw. Each of Frank's hands lands twice,      their movement is barely visible. The solid THUDDING      tells the story. Frank strikes bo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the Cuban's ears simultaneously with cupped hands. The Cuban goes down, stunned. Frank, his expression fierce, is upon him immediately. Frank's arms entwine the Cuban's and he begins to lift him roughly. At the end of the corridor, a woman screams. CLEANING WOMAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! Please. Don't hurt him. Please stop! Frank looks up. A hotel CLEANING WOMAN, carrying her purse, is running towards them, tears already on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't hurt my husband, mister.       He not up to nothing. Frank lets the Cuban down gently and stands up. Dis- gusted with himself. Breathing hard, he leans back against the wall. The Cleaning Woman falls to her knees and hugs her husband protectively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Frank steps away, rubs a hand through his hair, tries to collect himself. He's standing amidst dumpsters and discarded food boxes. He looks up and sees a marquee. RACHEL MARRON.   TONITE.   BENEFIT CONCERT.    8 P.M.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel is seated at her dressing table applying her makeup for the evening's performance. The telephone RINGS as she begins to work on her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher? No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby, is that you? It's mommy, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eerily distorted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess again, whore! Fuck you and fuck Miami. I'm coming for you. I know where you are and I'm coming for you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel is paralyzed by fear, unable to hang up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank comes in the front door. He's had it. Devaney, who has been sitting alone in the living room, stubs out a cigarette and stands to meet him. Frank doesn't pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm through. I'll get you back to L.A. and that's it. The guy with Fletcher can cover you till you get a replacement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She got another call, while you were downstairs and she answered it herself. It was him, Frank. Same guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving toward balcony)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farmer, it really shook her up. She thought it was going to be Fletcher calling her from L.A. I think she'll be reasonable now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (across him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save it, Devaney. The people who hire me don't have to be convinced to save their own lives. Frank reaches the sliding door that leads to the balcony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me when she's ready to go down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farmer -- Frank goes out on the balcony and slides the door closed behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank looks out at the ocean. The breeze washes over his face. A huge brightly-lit yacht is sailing by, close to shore. Frank looks at it reflectively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He senses another presence and looks to his right. Rachel sits huddled in a balcony chair. The bright  moon- light illuminates her as she looks out to sea. She  is wearing one of her spectacular show gowns, her hair has been brushed, and her stage makeup has been applied.   Bu tonight it hasn't come together. It doesn't work.   She holds a cigarette and the breeze keeps it glowing.  This is the only time we've seen her smoke. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farmer... Nothing that's happened between us matters... I understand now... You're going to have to believe me, because I'm not going to beg. She takes a long drag on her cigarette. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't what he said... it was the way he said it... he was so... Her voice cracks.   She stops and tries to compose hersel RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you... I'm afraid... and I hate it. I hate my fear... (a beat) Please protect me... Protect Fletcher... If anything happened to him... Frank looks at her. Tears are destroying her elaborate stage makeup. She wipes them away with her hand. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't protect you like this. It's impossible. The odds are on his side. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do whatever you say. This is the first time Frank has ever heard Rachel say that. He studies her, then looks out at the ocean. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to take you away for a while. Rachel nods. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somewhere people don't know about. She nods again, agreeing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Spector or Devaney or Tony. He looks at her, reading her face for any hesitation. There is none.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you cross me up this time, I'll kill you myself. Rachel smiles, weakly but with obvious relief.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: A large, old, two-story house sits at the top of a slight rise, surrounded on three sides by thick, rolling woods. Sloping gently down from the house to the lake fifty yard away is a broad expanse of lawn.  Snow lies on the ground and in the trees. At the edge of  the lake, a dock and boathouse. An entrance road cuts  out of the trees. A little TERRIER skitters to the edge of the drive BARKING. A van emerges from the trees, tires CRUNCHING through the snow. Frank's father, HERB, steps onto the front porch. He's in his mid-60's, lean, tan and fit. He's wearing a plaid shirt, jeans and cowboy boots. The van stops in front of the house. Frank steps out from the driver's seat and eyes his dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lake's a little low.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fill up soon enough when she thaws. (glancing at the van)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all in trouble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Herb squats on the floor with Fletcher. Together, they are happily playing around with the fluffy terrier. Fletcher squeals with delight as the dog licks his face. Henry brings the remaining luggage through. Rachel and Nicki stand with Frank near the archway. All eyes are on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher, Herb and the dog.       Rachel eyes the dog skeptically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's going to protect us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a trained noisemaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrific.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like big dogs. They don't know who they're eating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Herb stands beside a butcher block, cutting vegetables for the evening meal with a practiced hand. Rachel watches, drink in hand, looking around the kitchen. It has been neatly organized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katherine had this place organized just the way she wanted it. (seeing her questioning look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank's momma. There's the COUGH and SPUTTER of an outboard MOTOR from outside. Rachel looks from the kitchen window and sees Fletcher and Frank in the small skiff by the dock. Fletcher tugs again on the starter cord.       At the thi tug he tumbles backwards onto the seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher doesn't swim well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess he'd better stay in the boat then. (his smile puts her at ease)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank tells me you're a singer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid we're a little out of touch here. I'm sorry. Rachel waves this off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be very successful to need Frank. Rachel smiles and looks out of the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so quiet here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank came back and stayed six months after the Reagan thing. Rachel's questioning look encourages Herb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank wasn't there the day he was shot. He never got over that. (a long pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We buried Katherine that day. Rachel looks out again at Frank and Fletcher in the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher, Rachel and Frank are chugging across the golden water in the skiff. Fletcher sits at the back, operating the outboard, controlling the movements of the boat. He wears a life vest. Rachel watches him proudly. Fletcher locks the throttle into place and takes his hands off it for a laughing moment with a "Look, Mom, no hands" gesture. Rachel looks to Frank and smiles, the wind blowing her hair.

dialogues.speaker: LAKE
dialogues.text: CAMERA is DOWN at water level by the lake's edge. In the distance, the small boat skims across the surface. A light mist is coming up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry helps Fletcher tie up the boat for the night.   It is much foggier now and almost dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want anyone going out in it until you've checked it over first. Okay? Every time. Henry nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every time. In the distance, Rachel and Fletcher have just reached the house where Nicki scoops up Fletcher and spins him round and round in a circle. She hugs him close and kisses his hair.  After a few moments, Fletcher squirms free and runs to catch up with Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel, munching on a raw carrot, browses a row of family photographs. The sounds of dinner being prepared come from the kitchen. We see the history of the family in the pictures; Frank as a ten-year-old baseball player with a younger Herb; Herb as Police Chief of Bend, Oregon, being given a civic award; Frank as a college football wide receiver; Herb and Katherine Farmer, all dressed up and being introduced to Jimmy Carter by Frank; the picture-perfect family home in Oregon with Katherine tending flowers. Rachel notices a photo of a smiling Henry Kissinger, talking to some female reporters. There standing shoulder-to-shoulder with him, are Frank and Portman.
