Portman's also smiling at the women, flirting. Frank is in a familiar pose, alert, unsmiling, vigilant. Rachel looks at the two of them for a second. Frank steps from the kitchen with an orange juice and a drink for Rachel in his hand. He watches her for a moment as she studies the photo. She turns and sees him. They lock eyes for several seconds. She smiles as he hands her the drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inclining his head toward the photo)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Portman sometimes had trouble remembering what his job was. Supper's ready. We can see from Rachel's face that she feels embarrassed about her behavior in Miami.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The meal has been enthusiastically consumed. Fletcher's manhandling a chicken leg, his face covered with crumbs and drippings. Rachel shakes her head, laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And I never hit him. Ever. To this day. (to Frank)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's true, isn't it? (to Rachel)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's very unusual for my people. So what happens? When he's ten years old, he complains about it? Can you believe that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, for Chrissake! I'm going to tell her about the time you stripped in court. Frank gets up smiling and takes some dishes into the kitc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Frank)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care. I'm proud of that. (to Rachel)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, he's ten years old and he's just started playing tackle football. He comes to me and tells me he's afraid of getting hit, right? And he thinks it's because I never hit him. 'Why don't you ever hit me?' he says to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank puts down the dishes in the darkened kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (back over his shoulder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're lucky, maybe he'll tell you about my first jockstrap. As he speaks, he peers out through the window at the lake. We hear Herb's voice continue from the other room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He got over it: Turned into a helluva wide receiver. He couldn't stand being afraid. When he found something that scared him, he'd just do it 'til the fear went away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His mother was the same way. Rachel smiles at him, thinking, then looks through at Frank in the kitchen, still peering out of the windows. Nicki watches Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Herb delicately lifts  a chessboard from the top of a cabinet and walks it  over to the table: A half-finished game. He leans over   and blows on the pieces -- sending a small cloud of dust  into the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, son, you can run but you can't hide. Herb pulls up a chair and smiles as Frank appears from the kitchen, a bowl of popcorn in his hand. Frank takes a place across from his dad by the fire. The others gather round.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your move. Frank studies the board.   Rachel lowers her head into a cupped hand, fascinated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long has this game been going on? Frank picks up a knight, thinks, sets it back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three years. Nicki takes the bowl of popcorn and squats down with it beside Fletcher. Fletcher peers intently at the board as he chews on a handful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had me on the run there that first year. Frank picks up his rook, scratches his forehead with it. He turns to Fletcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think? Fletcher finishes a mouthful of popcorn, wipes his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knight to king-four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, Herbert and Rachel turn in synch and stare at the boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: City kid. Herb pats his leg, gesturing to Fletcher to take a place on his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come over here, Fletcher, sit by me. Fletcher goes over and joins him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's it for me, I'm going to bed. She rises. Frank follows her up the stairs.   Nicki watches them go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank stops at the end of the hallway, checking the lock on the window, the little terrier is at his heels. Rachel pauses outside the door. Frank gestures for the dog to stay. The dog sits in the middle of the hallway looking from one to the other. For a few seconds neither speaks. Frank smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, Rachel. Rachel accepts this. She smiles in return and touches him on the arm, very tenderly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, Frank. Rachel turns, goes to her room and closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Details are barely distinguishable in the fog. We hear the gentle LAPPING of the LAKEWATER against the dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher is asleep, snuggled on Herb's lap by the fire. Herb is also asleep. Frank fetches a blanket and gently

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: covers them both.    He puts out the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank steps quietly into the hall. Nicki is standing in the shadows. She watches as Frank goes through the ritual of locking the front door, several ways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're very thorough.

dialogues.speaker: AROUND INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Frank makes a circuit through the rooms of the first floor, checking windows and doors. Nicki tags along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening between you and Rachel? Frank glances at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. One minute she's got magnetic hands, the next she hates you. I can't figure out what it is now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You follow all her moves this closely?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a living.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it isn't. He moves away into the next room.    She hesitates a moment, then follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think my life is pretty sickly, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must.    I do. Frank steps into a tight, dark, little window alcove, checks the windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you change it? NICKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it that easy? Frank turns from the window to find Nicki blocking his ex She moves close to him and kisses him, her hands on his shoulders. The kiss ends and they look at each other. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a lovely woman. NICKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you don't want me. Frank's look affirms it.    Nicki is embarrassed, angry. NICKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm surprised. Thorough fellow like you. Why stop at one sister when you can fuck them both? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I make my mistakes. NICKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you didn't say no to the boss. She starts to turn away from him, but his hands are on he now, holding her close, refusing to let her turn away. Their faces are very close.    It is tight and near here. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with force) No, don't go away, Nicki. Don't leave me with that. Tell me about it. Tell me how long you've been second. Tell me how she has a child and you don't. Tell me something. But don't turn away and try to stick it on me. Nicki twists in his grip.    He holds her tight. NICKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need this from you. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I need it.     I'm fed up with people telling me    they have no control over their    lives. If you hate your life so    much, turn it around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not so simple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes it is. You can walk out that fucking door anytime you want. I'll unlock it for you. Nicki looks up into his face.    Tears start in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me go. He releases her, looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.     It's not my business. He moves away, OUT OF FRAME.    We HOLD ON Nicki, a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bright sun. Frank and his father walk along the lake shoreline, stooping here and there to finger animal prints in the snow and mud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raccoon... deer...? Herb nods. Their attention is drawn to soft singing up by the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicki absently sings an old gospel tune as she tosses breakfast scraps to a group of hungry ducks gathered by the porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never heard church music in the middle of the week before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicki's soft voice is joined by Rachel's strong harmony, and the two men watch as Rachel comes out to join her sister on the porch, startling Nicki. Both sing for a moment, together. Then Nicki stops, embarrassed. Rachel gives her a hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Herb and Frank are about to return to the house. They stop short. There, at their feet, is a line of human foot prints, from heavy snow boots, leading away into the trees. Frank looks at Herb, suddenly alert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Fletcher? Henry appears at the porch of the house, carrying a fishing rod as he comes out. At that instant, the sound of the OUTBOARD MOTOR CRACKLES through the air. Frank's head snaps toward the boathouse. Henry, in the distance, looks quickly at the boathouse, then to Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank! I haven't... But Frank is already moving, leaping from the porch and starting to run flat out toward the boathouse and dock. Rachel turns to look. The skiff appears out of the boathouse, Fletcher at the motor, the boat's lone occupant. The boat moves slowly away from the boathouse, parallel to the dock. Frank is running toward the water with everything he's got, his face contorted. The sound of the OUTBOARD drowns out his voice as he yells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher!   Fletcher!

dialogues.speaker: IN BOAT
dialogues.text: Fletcher, intent on his piloting, neither hears nor sees Frank running down the lawn behind him. The boat is approaching the end of the dock.

dialogues.speaker: DOCK
dialogues.text: Frank finally makes it to the dock and continues to sprint after the boat. His weight rattles the boards as he runs.

dialogues.speaker: IN BOAT
dialogues.text: Fletcher passes the end of the dock and gives the throttle a little twist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank reaches the end of the dock at a full run and dives directly at the rear of the moving boat. Frank's body flies out over the boat. He knocks Fletcher out of his seat and into the water on the other side of the skiff. RACHEL (screams)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!   He can't swim!

dialogues.speaker: IN WATER
dialogues.text: Frank holds the terrified, shaking Fletcher in his arms. Fletcher begins to cry. Frank paddles with him toward the dock. The empty boat swerves, then continues out toward the center of the lake.

dialogues.speaker: DOCK
dialogues.text: Henry and Rachel are already    at the end of the dock. N and Herb are running toward    it. Rachel is livid, hyste Henry peers out at the boat,    which continues to bounce innocently across the water,    defining a broad curve. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher, baby. Are you all right? Baby. Fletcher, spluttering, is handed up to Rachel by Frank. Rachel hugs Fletcher to her. Herb bends down to check he's breathing properly, wrapping the boy in his jacket. HERB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's all right. Henry helps Frank up out of the water.    Frank sits on the end of the dock, breathing hard. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? You out of your mind? You're crazy! (to Fletcher)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're all right, baby. (back to Frank)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could have drowned him! Frank and Henry look out toward the boat which has come to a stop out in the middle of the lake. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.   I got careless. Henry looks at Frank.    He feels terrible about not checking the boat. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, I'm sorry. I should have...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Henry. Herb puts his hand on Fletcher's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all right now, son? Fletcher nods, his crying ends raggedly.   Frank begins to stand up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we get the boat back? Out in the center of the lake, the BOAT BLOWS UP.    Ever one on the dock jumps. Nicki screams. Frank sits down again. He shakes his head. On an impulse, he stretches out his hand, palm downward.   It's trembling slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel and Nicki hurriedly pack their bags.   Fletcher hovers nearby.

dialogues.speaker: 162F
dialogues.text: Frank slides out from under the van. The hood is up. Henry stands nearby. Frank goes to the driver's seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Henry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back off. Henry moves away from the van.   Frank inserts the key in the ignition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Herb comes out of the house, fast. His eyes scan the woods as he heads towards the shed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank! Henry turns and motions to Herb to stay away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank takes a moment, then turns the key.    Nothing.   T van is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry and Herb watch.    Frank gets out of the van.   He walks to Herb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone's cut the phone lines. It could be anywhere between here and town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both the cars are dead. And I can't see how it was done. Frank and Herb exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who could know we're here? This place has nothing to do with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it has to do with you. Frank looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't walk out of here at night with them. Frank shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll button down tonight and walk out at first light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a light ground-mist. The moon shines down down brightly but the house is totally dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The terrier dog listens in the upstairs hallway. Herb watches from an upstairs window. Rachel lies in bed, clutching Fletcher tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank has been sitting in a chair in the center of the living room for two hours. Listening. Now we listen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with him. At first it seems silent, but slowly we become aware of a subtle symphony of sounds. An old house sur- rounded by WOODS. There are lots of NOISES. But they are regular, innocent. Frank is aware of a new noise, a gentle sobbing coming from nearby. He picks up his gun from the table beside him and goes into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicki is sitting with her head in her hands at the kitche table, sobbing. There's a nearly empty bottle beside her. Frank is instantly on the alert but makes no sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was an idiot last night. There is a long pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think about today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think this is no maniac.   He knows what he's doing. There is a long, long silence.   Nicki continues crying. Finally --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. He does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about it. She doesn't reply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it, Nicki?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He almost got Fletcher today...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we stop him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...my darling Fletcher...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.   I don't know. Frank goes to her, treats her gently, like a doctor. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can call him off. NICKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking her head) He doesn't even know who hired him. He doesn't know who I am and I don't know who he is. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you do it? She seems on the edge of hysteria. Frank takes her face in his hands, strokes her hair, brings her back from the brink. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How? NICKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I went to a bar in East L.A. I asked around... I talked to a man... FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name? NICKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (vague) ...Armando... He arranged it. That's all I know... FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it all paid for? NICKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) ... and then some... Till it's done. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He keeps going until he kills her? Nicki nods again, lowering her face into her hands. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the name of the bar? NICKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure... I was very stoned. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout the letters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperately)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no. You don't understand. The letters came first. I don't know who's sending them... but they're reading my mind... Those were my thoughts. I hate her. It made me think I could do it... But I could never hurt Fletcher. Never. (begging him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will. You and me. Tomorrow we're going back to L.A. We're going to find the bar, we're going to find Armando. He starts to rise.    She stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you even want to know why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told me.     She has everything. Frank stands up and begins to move across the room. Nicki puts her face in her hands and is silent for one moment. Suddenly, Frank freezes, listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if we can't -- Frank motions her into silence. We strain to hear what Frank hears. Silently, Frank goes to the door, crouch ing. He listens. There again is a DISTANT GROWL from the DOG upstairs. Frank lifts his gun from the table, turns to Nicki.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay here.    Don't move. Nicki's face shows true terror. Frank is out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank runs up them fast.    Two at a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank travels close to the wall, very quickly. He stops, listens. The TERRIER looks at Frank but still GROWLS. Frank throws open Rachel's door. Rachel gasps in surprise and clutches at Fletcher. Frank hears a noise behind him, whirls round him and drops to a knee, weapon ready to fire! It's Herb, stepping out of his room, carrying a police- issue pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me! Rachel's voice comes from her room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening? The terrier suddenly starts barking loudly.

dialogues.speaker: MOVING SHOT
dialogues.text: We're in someone's POV moving along the hallway. Nicki steps out of the kitchen a few feet ahead and looks in terror toward the CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no... stop... I'm the one who...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Herb spin around.    Rachel calls from her room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GUNSHOT BLASTS Nicki against the wall, her hand still delicately raised in a classic gesture of restraint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank's head spins to Rachel's doorway, then immediately back to Herb. He starts to move towards the stairs, fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Herb)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay with Rachel! Henry's head appears round the doorway of Herb's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank is rapidly down the stairs, gun in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank finds Nicki's body slumped against the wall.   He checks her. She's dead. The door beyond is open.     The wind blows in. Outside it's foggy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're okay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay with Rachel! The DOG continues to BARK upstairs. Frank sees a slight movement outside and window to his right. A split-second moment of decision. He heads off rapidly down the hall, away from the open door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fog is thick. Frank swiftly emerges from the back door and stops, dead still, listening. There is only the RUSTLING of TREES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Herb is by Rachel's bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening? Where's Nicki?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be quiet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank listens. Suddenly he hears RUNNING FOOTSTEPS, a body breaking through the bushes. Frank heads off towards the sound at a run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The move fitfully through the eerie, beautiful scene. In and out of the fog. Stop, listen,  wait, go. Two wary, interchangeable animals. Frank  disappears into the fog. When the figure reappears,  Frank is moving faster, closing the gap. The figure, seen in CLOSEUP for the first time, is wear- ing a dark-colored ski mask.  His breath billows out of the mouth hole, whitening in the cool March air. He hears Frank APPROACHING and points his gun in the direction of the FOOTSTEPS.  He does not fire. SILENCE. Frank stops and rests on his haunches. Listening, he hears the intruder move. The sounds have stopped up ahead. Close. The figure peers into the fog, gun up.   He's ready, confident. He waits. Nothing. Frank, from his crouch, does something brand-new. He raises his gun into the fog in a two-handed grip, ready to fire. He holds it easily. And then he does something really strange: Frank closes his eyes. After a beat, we hear MOVEMENT. Frank, eyes still closed, swings his gun 15 degrees and FIRES TWO BLASTS. The man jumps away from a small tree that has splintered six inches from his shoulder. His eyes are wild behind his ski mask. Frightened, he suddenly crashes away in the opposite direction. We FOLLOW. There is ANOTHER SHOT from Frank very close to the man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Herb is at the window. There is anguish on his face as he hears the SHOTS. He wants to go to his son's aid but knows he cannot leave Rachel. Rachel and Fletcher are huddled in the bed, terrified. Fletcher clutches at the DOG, which is still BARKING. Henry stands by the bed, gun in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank moves quickly through the woods, passes the splintered tree. We STAY WITH him and hear the ENGINE of a CAR ROAR to life and TIRES PEEL OUT of the dirt. Frank breaks out of the woods in time to see the red lights at the back of the car as it fishtails around a bend. He EMPTIES his GUN at it. We hear GLASS SHATTERING, but the car keeps going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow is falling. In the b.g. we see the flashing lights of a police car. Frank is on the phone to Minella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Frank, this doesn't make sense...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We already got him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?   Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Minella is talking with Frank on the phone. He's looking into an observation room through a one-way window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, last night. You should see his locker, Frank. The guy's obsessed with Rachel Marron...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sure it's him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forensics say it's 100 percent positive I.D... And he's got a black Toyota 4 x 4. Ray's with him now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting in the observation room at a table talking to Ray Court is Dan. He looks frightened and confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, whoever you got down there wasn't here last night. This was a professional...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is crazy... What do you want to do, Frank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long can you keep him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well technically all he's done is write some letters. 48 hours maximum. You know the deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel's black limousine moves slowly up the winding drive, followed by a black Mercedes limousine. Behind the cars, the gates close on a large press contingent gathered outside, held back by a large number of police and security guards. A light drizzle is falling. The two cars pull up to the entrance, Henry at the wheel of Rachel's. Frank gets out of the front and opens the back door. Devaney and Spector help Rachel and Fletcher out of the car. They are all dressed in black. A few other mourners, including Emma, get out of the Mercedes. Rachel, red-eyed and weary, takes Fletcher under her arm and goes inside. She does not look at Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hand takes a pitcher of orange juice from the refriger- ator and pours some into a large glass. They uncap a bottle of vodka and pour a huge portion into the orange juice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has grown very dark in the family room. Frank is sitting all alone, perfectly still, in one of the over- stuffed chairs, the vodka bottle on a table next to him. He stares off into space. A small voice comes out of the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay, Frank? Frank acknowledges Fletcher's small presence standing to the side of the big chair. He doesn't look at him directly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Fletcher, I'm okay.     How 'bout you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't sleep... It was so scary, just thinking about it... He looks at Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you feel scared, Frank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Fletcher, I do. Frank puts his hand gently on Fletcher's head, but he does not look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody's afraid of something, Flethcer. That's how we know we care about something, when we're afraid we'll lose it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you afraid of?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you should try to go back to sleep now, pal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me, Frank, please. Is it the man who killed Nicki? Are you afraid of him? Finally, Frank turns and looks at Fletcher.    Frank is pretty far gone. He shakes his head "no."     He realizes that that kind of fear had never occurred to   him, and recognizing that fact sets him back into his   thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what?    What are you afraid of? Frank doesn't have the will to resist anymore.    He lets his hand drop away from Fletcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid... of not being there... Fletcher stares at him, uncomprehending.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's late. Do you want me to take you back to your room? Fletcher shakes his head "no," just barely.    Then he disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, silhouetted, moves toward the stairway to the main level. There is light up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank begins climbing the stairs. When he has gone a quarter of the way up, Rachel appears at the top and begins walking down. At first she doesn't see Frank; when she does she hesitates a moment, then continues down. They meet and try to sidestep each other, but twice they go in the same direction, unable to get around. Rachel, already emotionally ravaged, cracks. She begins slapping Frank hard about the face and torso. One of the first blows knocks the GLASS from his hand; it SMASHES loudly against the wall. He raises his arms in a half-hearted attempt to protect himself from the onslaught. She cries as she hits him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hysterical)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, you, you... You brought this pain into my house... Now you're here! Where were you then? Why didn't you save her? It was your job to protect me and she died doing it... It was me they were after. And you let them kill her! (she gasps for air)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She never did anything to anyone. As she loses the strength and the will to hit him, her blows become sloppy, weak. She sinks to the steps, sitting on them, sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She never hurt anyone. She was good. (she looks at him; entreats him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw her. She never wished anyone any harm. Did she? Did she? Frank looks at her, shakes his head "no." Rachel puts her head in her hands and is silent for a few moments; her crying slows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally, quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She never hurt a soul. (long pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I didn't love her well enough. I didn't take care of her... (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... She gave me only love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits quietly on the steps in the gloom. Frank watches for a long moment, then softly continues on his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's bright sunshine. Fletcher is splashing noisily in the pool with a few other kids. His nanny waits patiently at the side, towels at the ready. At one side of the pool, Rachel sits, lost in thought, mourning her sister. At the other side sits Frank, also thoughtful. He, too, is trying to adjust to the tragedy for which he bears some of the responsibility. The SHOUTS and LAUGHTER of the kids continue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guardhouse at the main gate is brilliantly illumi- nated in the distance. The guard patrols at his station. Inside, the T.V. screens flicker and glow. Perched on the top of a slight   hill, Frank sits alone a motionless under a big tree.    He gazes down at the gate house, his face lit softly by   the glow from its lamps. All around him the rest of the   estate is quiet and tranquil in the moonlight. After a moment, another silhouetted figure slowly ap- proaches and stands beside him. It's Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you've heard what's happening. Frank nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind if I sit down? Frank shakes his head. They sit side by side for awhile, both lost in thought. Rachel seems very calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It isn't over yet, is it? Frank shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows he still hasn't got you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he'll come again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's possible. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Oscars? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. Rachel takes this philosophically.     She tugs at the grass, thinking. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was back in Squirrel Hill, I started betting my friends fifty bucks each that someday I'd win an Oscar. You can understand how important it is that they see me up there if I win. She looks at him and smiles. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If everyone of those pikers comes through, it could add up to a lot of money. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's very dangerous. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. But I can't stay up here on my hill forever. They are silent for awhile.     Rachel lies back on the grass, stares at the sky. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't get to this place in my life by doing the smart thing every time. (as Frank nods) How 'bout you, Frank Farmer? Out there on the edge... did you ever do something that didn't make too much sense, except maybe inside you? In your stomach somewhere? Something that wasn't smart? (looks at him) I'll bet you have plenty. I'll bet you do. Nobody gets really good without it. And you're good. I know that. She sits up beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know why all this has happened to me... (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... but I do know that none of it's your fault. I hope you can hear me, because this is how I say I'm sorry. Frank accepts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relieved)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... I'm going to go see if I win an Oscar. And I won't worry about it at all. Because I've got you to protect me. Frank almost smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. He looks at her a long time, then takes her in his arms. He kisses her and lays her down. His body moves over hers. Like a bodyguard, protecting her from the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chaos and razamatazz of Oscar night.   Crowds, limos, cameras, searchlights...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The limo is waiting in a line of limos to reach the red- carpeted entrance to The Pantages Theatre. Frank and Tony sit in front with Henry. In the back a spectacularly-gowned Rachel sits flanked by Devaney and Spector, both of whom, like Frank, are wearing tuxedos. ahead, they can all see the hubbub at the entrance: TV cameras, lights, photographers, arriving guests, two bleachers full of fans. The glare from the arc lights is almost blinding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll go straight back to the Green Room. Right, Frank? Frank nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got that, Tony?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony knows what he's doing. Tony looks at Frank, surprised and not a little pleased with the unexpected support.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish you boys would relax a little. Nothing bad's gonna happen out there, alright? (the old Rachel)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless I lose the fucking award. She looks around at the men, all are tense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, what a crew. Rachel leans forward and flips down the mirror on the panel in front of her and checks her appearance. The limo moves up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw it. I'm through worrying. When your number's up, it's up. Right, Farmer? The limo is almost at the red carpet.   Frank slips out the front door of the moving limo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More quartz lights click on. The TV cameras all focus on the door of the limo as Frank steps out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as he surveys the busy scene. A microphoned M.C. peers into Rachel's limo and walks toward it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Miss Rachel Marron! ON TV CAMERA MONITOR we see Rachel wave to the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone wishes you the best tonight, Rachel. Frank leads the small procession down the red carpet. Fans reach out asking for his autograph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as his glance darts around: high into the bleachers, ahead in the distance, to the door, to the side at photographers nodding to the massed security men with their walkie-talkies. Rachel's smile is convincing, lovely, professional. Spector, Devaney and Tony look strained. As they enter, a WIDE SHOT from across the street shows their limo pulling ahead as the next car pulls up. The CAMERA TRACKS SIDEWAYS to reveal the rear fender of a Toyota 4X4 parked in the foreground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is large and has been fitted with a bar and buffet. Formally-dressed presenters and hosts mill about, laugh- ing and talking. Many greet Rachel. A TV monitor hangs from the ceiling in one corner. On it, the Academy Awards continue. An elaborate dance number is just concluding. The audience applauds. Beside the monitor, a large clock with a ticking second hand. A harried associate producer SKIP THOMAS, comes up to Rachel, settled in an armchair. Tony stands nearby, Frank leans against a far wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Rachel. I need to get you straight on your responsibilities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, Skip. Skip takes a typewritten sheet from a sheaf in his hand and gives it to Rachel. He consults a clipboard as he speaks. There, laid out minute by minute, is the order of the evening's events. Each one has a precise time printed beside it, including those that involve Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, it's Best Sound, then another song, then you. At precisely (looks at his clipboard) -- 8:07, you'll be presenting with Clive Healy. Those are your lines. The prompter's straight ahead and -- we pray -- working perfectly. Rachel nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, you'll be a big shot someday, Skip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skip smiles and walks off, glancing up at the clock. 7:43. CLIVE HEALY, a slim British actor appears, bows and kisses Rachel's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand it's my great honor to escort you onstage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, Clive. And I don't like it one bit that you look skinnier than me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TV MONITOR - The show is progressing, flashing out across the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And the award for Best Achievement in Sound goes to Kay Colvin and Mychal Smith for Hot And Cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Applause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you so much. I want to thank our producers, Karen Golden and Ed Gorsuch, as well our sound crew -- Richard Goodman and Blair Forward. I'm too excited -- but they're the real winners tonight. Thank you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is wonderful. This is like, the happiest moment of my life. I'd like to thank our wonderful sound crew for all the evenings and weekends they sacrificed, the incredible wizards down at Distant Thunder Sound Studios, Roger and Greg for hiring us and my family for being so patient. We did it! Thank you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The celebrities in the Green Room drink, eat and talk. Rachel is deep in a giggling, girlish conversation with another actress. Skip Thomas approaches Rachel again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel.    One more song, then you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel nods, goes back to her conversation.       Frank s up to Tony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to have a look around. I'll come back for her. Stay alert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony nods, watches Frank go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank moves down the hall from the Green Room toward the stage. Stagehands, technicians, performers speak in hushed tones. TV monitors are mounted throughout the area. On screen a distinguished-looking actor named REARDON is serving as temporary master of ceremonies. Frank walks along, checking the route, looking up into the flies. He rounds a corner and is face to face with Portman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Portman.   What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Portman points at a nearby TV monitor.      On screen, Reardon is introducing the next song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on TV screen) My mother has always thought I was the star of every movie I've been in. You remember 'Night Of The Stranger'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Applause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You probably don't remember me in that. My mother can tell you about it. To this day, she thinks it's about a desk clerk at the hotel where what's-his-name is hiding out from the cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now it's time to hear the final nominated song, from the film 'Queen Of The Night' -- 'I Have Nothing.' And here to sing it for us, the multi-talented Miss Sandra Castle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (during the above) Short-term gig... but quite profitable... Listen, Frank, I'm sorry about Miami. You know, nothing really happened... I felt bad for you... I wanted to say something, but you disappeared...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (NOTE: "I Have Nothing" fanfare. Dancers onto stage. First section of song, commencing with shortened chorus then first verse (Total 1 Minute) Reardon walks off the stage ten feet from where Frank and Portman are standing, glances at them and moves off down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to work. I'll probably see you at the Governor's Ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Portman walks off after Reardon.    Frank watches him, thoughtful. ON TV MONITOR - Sandra Castle sings "I Have Nothing" with great feeling. The lyrics recall the text of the death threat.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK'S FACE
dialogues.text: suddenly wary.    No rational cause.   Something in the a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel's face as she watches Sandra Castle on the monitor She is at a makeup table. MUSIC is LOUD. The celebrities in the Green Room are impressed with Sandra's performance. There is spontaneous applause. Rachel turns to the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want that broad run out of town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank calls Tony on his SURV-KIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony, you there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony, I've got a feeling this is the night. I think he's gonna go for her in front of all the cameras. The kind of thing only a lunatic would do. That's how he wants it to look. Except he isn't a lunatic. He's very clever. I need you to help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm with you, Frank. There's no more competition between them. Three sound technicians appear at Frank's side, very agitated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Frank)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't use that thing back here. The  breakthrough's killing our radio mikes... We'll have to disconnect you. Reluctantly, Frank disconnects his earpiece.

dialogues.speaker: 195A
dialogues.text: Tony fiddles with his earpiece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank?... Frank? Technicians approach Tony, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big finish of song and dance number (total 40 seconds). Applause and dancers off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank walks past Tony. Tony holds up the earpiece in frustration. Frank nods. He walks over to Rachel. He seems tense and she senses it. And like a tangible thing, his anxiety is passed over to her. She is frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (spooked)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong? Skip Thomas appears at her side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel... Clive. Let's go, okay? Clive Healy comes over. Rachel must tear her eyes away from Frank. Tony floats up behind them. Skip regards him with irritation and turns to Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating Tony)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really. Must we have everyone? We have our own men at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony stays. Skip looks at Rachel for a response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!    I want him. Skip shrugs.    Clive takes Rachel's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come, Rachel, let us brighten the firmament. Rachel forces a smile, but her eyes follow Frank as he starts to lead the way out of the Green Room. On an impulse, she reaches for something from the makeup table and presses it into her hand. It's the Russian Orthodox cross. She clutches it like a talisman and follows Frank. Tony brings up the rear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group moves down the hall from the Green Room, past the stage right wings. Behind the scenery to the back of the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: in blue, celebrity guests, technicians. His eyes examine each curtain, corner and recess. He looks above him. CLOSEUP ON RACHEL'S FACE as she looks around nervously.

dialogues.speaker: HER BODY
dialogues.text: is tense on Clive's arm.   Clive pats her arm soothingly. CLIVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try to relax, Rachel. I know you must be very excited. Skip leads them to a set of temporary stairs behind the scenery; they lead to the center of the top tier. Production aides with clipboards and headphones wait up there.

dialogues.speaker: THE CLOCK
dialogues.text: SKIP (pointing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel, you'll go in there and Clive, you over there. You'll meet on the landing. They both nod, but Rachel is distracted, tense. SKIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch your step going down. Someone spilled some water. Clive and Rachel climb the stairs. Rachel turns once more to look anxiously at Frank. She clutches the cross but he doesn't see. Frank watches them ascend. He signals Tony to stay there until Rachel goes on. Frank moves off toward the stage left wings. ON TV MONITOR - we see Reardon, acting as Master of Ceremonies, doing the introductions. REARDON (V.O.) (on screen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to have an outfit just like that... And to present the Best Song award we have our debonair friend from England and the lady who has everything -- Clive Healy and Rachel Marron! A red camera light clicks on. MUSIC UP, APPLAUSE, as we see Clive and Rachel make their entrances on the TV monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank swiftly adjusts his position so he can still see the stage. As he does, he glances under the scaffolding that supports the set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel and Clive reach the podium. Clive is all smiles. Rachel is trying, but is obviously distracted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the applause dies away, we see  what they see: TV cameras, an orchestra in the pit,  the huge audience, and the bright glare of the lights.   At the front of the podium is the transparent plastic  of the teleprompter; their lines can be clearly seen,  printed out and moving vertically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading from the prompter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Rachel, I know that you only came tonight to present this award and you'll want to leave as soon as we're done. Rachel's lines appear on the prompter, but she does not start reading them immediately. They stop moving on the screen. Rachel's face, her eyes darting about. There is an awful silence.

dialogues.speaker: BRIGHT RED LIGHT
dialogues.text: on the nearest TV camera. The teleprompter, now showing Clive's lines. The light. A man in the first row of the audience. CLOSE ON HER HANDS as they squeeze the cross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over the course of the evening we've heard five smashing songs and the names of the artists who created them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, watching Rachel, hears the barely audible CLICKING start from the tiny receiver on his belt. He's puzzled. His eyes dart to Rachel's hand and he sees the cross. He knows what she's going through. Her hand is shaking

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: badly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sways. Clive supports her as discreetly as he can, smiling out at the audience. FROM BEHIND Clive and Rachel, we watch as Clive picks up Rachel's lines from the prompter, AD LIBBING to make them fit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I know that no matter what anyone thinks, you have no personal favorites. Thin laughter. The audience is starting to sense that something is wrong with Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Best Song nominees are: "Clock On The Wall" from 'The Dining Room Table' -- By Dana S. Lee and Sara Spring. 'Give Me Your Trust' from 'Out Of the Gloom' -- By David Siegel and Barbara G. Gordon. "I Have Nothing" from 'Queen Of The Night' -- By Nancy Garbor. "Maybe Soon" from 'Maybe Soon' -- Anne Trop and Ben Glass. And "Reflections Of My Heart" from 'Hot And Cold' -- By Leslie Moraes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An usher near the wall shifts his weight. The orchestra conductor turns to look at her. A musician turns his sheet music. The dark at the back of the balcony. The teleprompter.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: as he alone hears the CLICKING -- monitors her distress and fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blurting her prompter lines)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Clive, let's find out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The teleprompter operator has been thrown off and now takes a moment to get it moving again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading) -- let's find out who the winner is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The envelope. Rachel, shall I do the honors?

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE'S HANDS
dialogues.text: work at the envelope, tearing, freeing the flap.       Hi fingers work to pull out the contents.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL'S FACE
dialogues.text: watching. The CLICKING is almost deafening -- like a heartbeat.

dialogues.speaker: THE CLOCK
dialogues.text: The second hand ticks in enormous CLOSEUP.       It's 8:0

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: on a trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: drifts lazily towards us out of the muzzle of a gun in ultra SLOW MOTION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: bring out one of the pasted-up death threats with the familiar opening lines -- 'MARRON BITCH -- YOU HAVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Clive pulls the card out of the envelope.       It rea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music by

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel gasps, stifles a scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the winner is "I Have Nothing"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: from 'Queen Of The Night' music and lyrics by Nancy Garbor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel loses control, backs away from the podium and runs off stage right. The audience applauds the winner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is so exciting. I can't begin to describe what it feels like to stand here -- with this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First, I want to thank Rachel Marron. Without her support, encouragement and determination to help get an unknown songwriter heard, I wouldn't be standing here. A lot of people talk about how they're going to help others once they make it themselves, but Rachel really follows through. I'd also like to thank Helen Pollak, a wonderful producer, who never got fed up with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank sees Rachel run off the opposite side of the stage and heads over there, around the back of the scenery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clive, the professional, stands holding the envelope. glances off after Rachel, mystified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cluster of people   surround Rachel, comforting her. Frank comes up. He    does not try to force his way throu to Rachel. People    begin to move away, the cluster thin Two stars move off   toward the back of the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always said she was nuts.    I've always said that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clive Healy comes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is assured that she is.       Clive goes out to his se

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: in the audience. As the people move off, Rachel becomes clearly visible to Frank. Tony is standing next to her, but another man has his arm around Rachel, comforting her Rachel's face is tear-stained and she dabs at it with a handkerchief. She is recovering fast. Past her fear, she is now very embarrassed. Her voice is strong. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, what an idiot I am. Jesus. What the hell's the matter with me? Frank moves up closer, and exchanges looks with Tony, who is confused by Rachel's behavior. Rachel turns toward Frank and, in so doing, brings the man comforting her around to face Frank. It is Reardon. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farmer, you've made me a raving lunatic. Frank barely hears Rachel, so struck is he   by Reardon's presence. Frank looks around them quickly    for Portman. Rachel looks at Frank with irritation and   turns back toward the Green Room. A production aide    signals Reard REARDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Rachel) I have to go back out.   Are you okay? RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for your help, John. I'm fine. Rachel walks off toward the Green Room with Tony. Reardon starts to walk out toward the stage. Frank stops him. Reardon is irritated. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Portman? REARDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Portman. REARDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breaking away) Never heard of him. Reardon walks out on stage. Frank is left standing alone. All the weariness comes back, all his senses start to hum Frank looks around, then moves off toward the Green Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel sits at a makeup table.   Skip Thomas approaches, clipboard in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel, I'm sorry, but if you're going to be in your seat for the Best Actress award, you've got to do it now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skip, I'm moving as fast as I can. For chrissake, go twitch somewhere else. Skip backs off.   Spector and Frank join the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, everything's fine. No one noticed anything. Everybody in this building is ready to jump out of their skin from nerves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit, you saw me. Farmer's made me a raving lunatic --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's going on you should know about --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're making her crazy.   You're making us all crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel, I know who it is. He's here tonight. I think he's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up... This is the last straw. She throws down the powder and stands up fast, makeup and purse flying. The powder com- pact bursts over the cross lying on the table. Everyone in the Green Room looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hissing at him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, you maniac! You never stop. Now you've made an ass of me in front of a billion people. And you won't quit. They stare at each other and everyone else stares at them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel walks swiftly out the door of the Green Room. Frank sits for a moment, then stands up. The bodyguard follows his charge to the door. He whispers hurriedly at Tony as they leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony, it's Portman.   Remember?   The guy from Miami... Spector grabs Tony's sleeve, pulling him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After tonight, you're back in charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows nothing about show business. Tony squares off with Spector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reardon is just introducing TOM WINSTON, the actor who will announce the Best Actress award.

dialogues.speaker: BEST ACTRESS INTRO, (TOTAL 1 MINUTE)
dialogues.text: (Reardon back on stage to applause, Reardon linking material (maybe gags.) Reardon intros Winston. Play on Winston to applause.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Presenting the Best Actress award, we have the man who last year received the top honor an actor can achieve for his performance in "South Of Waco". Ladies and gentlemen, Tom Winston!

dialogues.speaker: APPLAUSE
dialogues.text: Frank watches, his eyes scanning, searching the vast theatre, squinting as he tries to see beyond the glare of the klieg lights and the cameras.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, John, thank you, Academy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It brings back some great memories to be standing here again. Last year I figured something out. While it is a great honor to be nominated, actually winning caps the evening very pleasantly.

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: on stage, speaking and then listing the nominees.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, DEVANEY AND SPECTOR
dialogues.text: in their seats, up the aisle toward the back of the theatre, high into the gloom of the balcony.

dialogues.speaker: STAGE
dialogues.text: WINSTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight we give this award not to the best actress, but to the best performance by one of five exquisitely talented artists... FRANK'S FACE - searching. TV CAMERA - focused on the audience.    Its red light goe on.

dialogues.speaker: ON SCREEN
dialogues.text: Rachel's face, expectant, nervous on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: THE PATH
dialogues.text: Rachel would have to take to the stage, the steps to the stage, the faces of the ushers near the stage, the conductor, ready to play theme music. WINSTON (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And the nominees for best performance by an actress in a leading role are -- Constance Simpson for Hot and Cold...

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: APPLAUSE. Frank slips through the curtained doorway that leads to the backstage. WINSTON (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Ellen Pearson for Maybe Soon... More APPLAUSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank comes up swiftly. He stops behind a curtain, six feet from the path the winner will take. Tony is there. Frank speaks to him and, as he does, he puts a hand on Tony's arm. They both look across the stage, past Winston into the wings on the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the wings of the opposite side of the stage, half hidden by a curtain, a TV cameraman is hoisting his lightweight portable camera onto his shoulder. His back is to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Rachel Marron for Queen Of The Night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony, I want you on the other side... and check out that guy. He's not supposed to be there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony trots off quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cameraman half-turns toward us, peering past the curtain into the audience. For a split second, we glimpse his face. It's Portman. Then someone crosses quickly in front of him and he's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: L.C. Dean for I Dream Of Peace ...and Evelyn Gardner for The Harper Plan...

dialogues.speaker: BACKSTAGE
dialogues.text: Frank draws his gun. He glances quickly to Tony, but Tony's already on his way, trotting round the labyrinth behind the set. Frank automatically raises his sleeve to call to Tony, then realizes his communications are useless. He tries to see where Portman has disappeared to, but he daren't lose sight of Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the winner is... Rachel Marron for Queen Of The Night.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK'S FACE
dialogues.text: grim.   He looks past the curtain to Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: AUDITORIUM
dialogues.text: Deafening applause in the main auditorium. A stunned Rachel stands. Devaney and Spector kiss her. People nearby reach out to touch her. Rachel walks along her row. The orchestra plays "I Have Nothing."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mass of drapes and flats. Behind them, the cameraman is fixing something to the side of his camera. His back is to us. Tony comes up briskly behind him, unable to see his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! You! What the fuck you think you're doin' back here... With amazing speed, the cameraman - Portman - wheels around, simultaneously jabbing two outstretched fingers from his free hand straight into Tony's eyes. Tony cries out, his hands flying to his face. Portman's hand moves swiftly again, jabbing to a nerve behind Tony's ear, Tony drops like a sack. Glancing rapidly around, Portman sees all other eyes on the auditorium. He pulls the curtain around Tony's body - obscuring it. He then removes his own "SECURITY" ID and fixes a laminated "PRESS" ID to his lapel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank gestures animatedly to the head of security and several guards. The music and the applause drown out his words and we do not hear them. The guards rush off backstage and into the auditorium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel walks along her row. Hands reach out to her. Some people stand in their seats around her. A crane- mounted TV camera swoops down between Frank and his view of Rachel, obscuring her for a brief instant.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK'S FACE
dialogues.text: Desperately scanning, seeking.   Suddenly his face freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Rachel reaches the center aisle and starts to walk toward the steps, there in the far aisle, his face almost hidden, is Portman -- the camera, hand-held on his shoulder, moving level with Rachel, 20 feet behind her. Frank raises his gun.

dialogues.speaker: AISLE
dialogues.text: Rachel walks down the aisle toward the side steps. Tears in her eyes. Thunderous applause. Security guards in the side aisles look around in all directions. They can't see anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON Portman, now almost completely obscured behind the members of the audience, as more and more of them stand to applaud Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALONG THE SIDE OF THE CAMERA. Rachel keeps appearing and disappearing behind the heads of the audience.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK IN THE WINGS
dialogues.text: Desperate to get a clear shot at Portman but unable to fire without hitting a bystander.

dialogues.speaker: FROM STAGE RIGHT WINGS
dialogues.text: as she  approaches the podium, steadily, controlling herself  as she mounts the steps. The outline of her body becomes  difficult to see against the glare of the foot- lights  and the lights at the side of the auditorium.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK'S FACE
dialogues.text: His eyes squint against the dazzle.

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: Rachel approaches Winston.   The applause and music is

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: deafening.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK'S FACE
dialogues.text: He can't see Portman past the glare. He can't fire into the audience. He knows Rachel is now at her most vulner- able. There is only one thing he can do to protect his charge.

dialogues.speaker: BACKSTAGE WINGS
dialogues.text: Frank runs on stage at terrific speed and leaps through the air at Rachel, twisting his body as he does.

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: Rachel turns her head, sees Frank leaping at her and gasps out with a mixture of fury and terror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: PORTMAN
dialogues.text: The silenced PISTOL taped to the side of the camera FIRES ONCE. TWICE.

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: Frank and Rachel tumble over on the floor. The podium topples. There are screams from the audience.

dialogues.speaker: AUDITORIUM
dialogues.text: Pandemonium breaks out. Men run on stage from all directions. Guns are drawn. Everyone is shouting. TV cameras whip-pan in all directions, security men shout into walkie-talkies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaos on all screens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to commercial...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Totally calm and, as he gambled, invisible in the commo- tion. Camera still on his shoulder, he slowly backs away from the scene. Ushers and uniformed security men rush past him towards the stage. People leap from their seats. A woman screams piercingly behind him. Portman doesn't blink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dozens more helpers pour onto the stage around Frank and Rachel. Rachel starts to rise on all fours and sees, as hands reach out to help her, the blood on Frank's shirt. He has taken the hits for her. But he's still on the job, gaze alert. Without taking his eyes from the audi- torium, his left arm stretches out, with some pain, to push Rachel back down. The right arm, gun in hand, sweeps the auditorium. Where is Portman? Frank can't see past the mob. Ushers fall on Frank in a heap, trying to disarm him. Security men try to pull them off. Rachel shouts, trying to make herself heard above the noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's my bodyguard. Get off him! He's O.K...

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: A SERIES of SWIFT LOW ANGLE SHOTS through legs and faces. One brief glimpse that could be Portman. A cameraman turns. It's not. Frank is desperate, pushing away a helping arm. The chaos mounts. SIRENS WAIL outside.

dialogues.speaker: PORTMAN
dialogues.text: He turns away from the stage as four cops pound past him. He walks away. Suddenly, for one brief second, his face loses its composure as he looks to the side door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hysterical audience members jostle for the exit, screamin and shouting. It's like a football scrum. Cops and secur- ity men pushing and pulling. His escape route is blocked.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK'S FACE
dialogues.text: Briefly glimpsed through blurred, frenzied, f.g.   Still seeking his target, biting his lip in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool again, he turns back to the stage, seeking an alternative escape route, camera still providing cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lumbering figure, blood streaming from one eye, his .38 drawn and outstretched. It's Tony staggering to the edge of the stage, straight towards his attacker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bellowing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank! Frank! Over here!

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: Frank and Rachel's heads swivel in unison at the sound, looking towards the far aisle.

dialogues.speaker: PORTMAN
dialogues.text: Against the side wall at the front, Portman's eyes desperately scan for the source of the voice. He sees Tony, his pistol takes aim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a split second, two running figures f.g. pass and cross leaving a momentary clear line to Portman.

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: Frank FIRES.   ONCE.   TWICE.

dialogues.speaker: PORTMAN
dialogues.text: Frank's bullets hit home. The first slams Portman in the chest, knocking him against the wall. The second hits the CAMERA on his shoulder, EXPLODING it around his face.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE ACADEMY MEMBER
dialogues.text: Blood spatters her white Armani dress and the shirt- front of her escort. Portman's body slumps forward in her lap, pinning her back in her seat. He's dead. His pistol drops onto a pair of shiny, black leather pumps.

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: Frank holds his aim steady, reluctant to look away. He half turns to Rachel, wincing with the effort. She's unhurt. He has fulfilled his promise to her. Rachel throws her arms around Frank and hugs him, tears streaming down her cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank Farmer's face. Sad and weary. His guard is finally down. Nothing more can happen. He slowly lowers the gun, closes his eyes and lets his head fall onto his chest.

dialogues.speaker: SPECTOR
dialogues.text: In the midst of the commotion of medics, security men, police and ushers, Spector bends down and gently retrieve the gold envelope and the card bearing Rachel's name. There are splatters of blood on it. He tries to wipe them off with the silk handkerchief from his breast pocke

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chaos of press and public, ambulance and police lights flashing, SIRENS WAILING.

dialogues.speaker: PART OF CROWD
dialogues.text: Police and paramedics surrounding a man on a stretcher -- it is Frank -- Rachel walks at his side, clutching his hand as he is rushed to an ambulance. Tony, a dressing over his eyes, is also helped out by paramedics. Among the gathered crowd, we focus in on one face. It is Dan, pushed back to the sidelines and unable to see what is happening. He slowly turns and walks away. CAMERA CRANES to a HIGH WIDE SHOT of the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A buffed-out charter turboprop stands on the tarmac as the last pieces of equipment of Rachel's band are loaded aboard from a truck. A limousine pulls up and Rachel gets out with Tony and Court, who is clearly acting as her bodyguard. She greets some members of the band and others who will be part of her entourage. A roadie has her luggage removed from the limo and loaded aboard the plane. Devaney is trying to hurry her on board. Spector is conspicuous by his absence. As Rachel and the others prepare to get onto the plane, Tony, wearing a dark leather eyepatch, reacts to something O.S. Frank approaches from the nearby parking area. He is pale. Under his clothes it can be seen that his torso is still taped. He smiles as Tony. Their handshake becomes a quick abrazo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating eyepatch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's it going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under control. But it won't be the same... ya mutt. Tony fakes a glancing blow to Frank's chin. Over by the plane, Fletcher spots Frank and tugs at Rachel's dress, till she turns to look. Fletcher runs up to Frank and hugs him around the knees. Rachel approaches and Tony moves back toward the plane. Devaney waves in Frank's direction, tapping his watch to indicate they are late. Frank waves and smiles. Rachel's surprised to see Frank, but clearly happy. Fletcher is ecstatic. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't be here. Frank laughs.    There is a pause. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you're quitting show business? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad. You had talent.      What are you going to do? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I might hole up with my dad. (pats bandaged torso) Finish that chess game. Rachel nods approvingly. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him when Fletcher's not around. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ruffling Fletcher's hair) That's the idea. Fletcher grins.   Rachel starts to cry. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, how's the new guy? RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got white hair, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's very good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you have to get me an old man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't trust you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... well, give me a kiss and let's get this over with. Frank gives her an awkward hug.   They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Bye Rachel. Rachel turns quickly. She almost runs up the boarding ladder. Frank remains watching her. Fletcher looks back over his shoulder as they disappear into the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel takes a seat beside Fletcher.   Devaney leans over the aisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wasn't so bad. (he sees her tears)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay? Rachel is in her own world. Devaney passes the word to get moving. The ENGINES WARM UP. Rachel turns and sees Frank still standing there looking at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pilot's hand pushes forward on the throttle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nosewheel starts to taxi.    The plane moves forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel's face at the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The steps start to fold down out of the plane, but not fast enough for Rachel. She jumps the last six feet, staggering slightly as the plane's jet wash hits her, whipping her clothes and hair. Without pausing, she runs to Frank who takes her in his arms. They embrace and kiss. They kiss again and again. Finally, slowly, Rachel draws back, her eyes are filled with tears. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember when you said you'd risk your life for me? Frank tries to break in, but she won't let him interrupt. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't really believe it then. Nobody means what they say. But you did, Frank. You did it. You laid it all on the line for me. Frank tries to speak, she puts her hands to his lips. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't wreck this for me. I don't want to hear any bullshit about you just doing your job. You did more than save my life, Frank. You showed me a way to be. And I love you for it. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There, I said it. (looks at him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll never forget what it felt like to be under your eye. Never. FRANK (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't be forgetting you either. She presses something into Frank's hand. RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here... I want you to keep this. If you ever need me, you just put this on and no matter where you are I will find you.  I promise. She gives him a quick kiss and walks back toward the plane, her eyes holding Frank's. Frank opens his palm to reveal the little enamel cross.

dialogues.speaker: ON FRANK
dialogues.text: as the engines roar and the plane turns to taxi out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ROAR of the plane becomes APPLAUSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel's face in FULL FRAME, bathed in light and the applause of a huge audience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you... Thank you... Now I want to sing you an old song, but it's a new favorite. As the music begins, Rachel stands alone in front of the band, mike in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, this song used to make me feel sad... But it doesn't anymore. Rachel pauses.   The audience is still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now it just reminds me of someone very special... This is for him. Rachel begins to sing the song 'WHAT BECOMES OF THE BROKEN HEARTED' - slow and sweet. It's the song she and Frank danced to.    As a VERSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a Rotary Dinner. The CAMERA TRACKS ALONG the front of the head table which runs from one side of the room to the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our speaker this evening, the honorable congressman from the fifth district, Galen Windsor, has been a lone, courageous, voice... he alone has challenged those who have linked organized crime with legitimate business throughout our state. STILL TRACKING, we see the Rotary  President as he nods t a distinguished-looking gentleman  one seat to his right. On the wall a sign identifying the  hotel and a club banner which reads -- "THE ROTARY  CLUB OF IOWA CITY." The CAMERA CONTINUES to TRACK and  the Rotary President goes OUT OF FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But first our benediction will be delivered by Reverend Phillip Hardy of the First Presbyterian Church. STILL TRACKING we see the Reverend get up as the men around him bow their heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heavenly Father, please bless us today as we meet in friendship and duty. STILL TRACKING as we REACH the end of the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Lord, whatever dangerous endeavors those among us may take, let them never be without your sanctuary. The CAMERA STOPS. Standing against the wall behind the table is Frank. As the Reverend's prayer goes on, all heads are bowed to receive the benediction. All heads but Frank's. The CAMERA MOVES IN TIGHT ON his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... For all we know in our hearts that even though we may walk through the valley of the shadow of death, you are with us... guiding and protecting us. Amen. The Reverend's final words segue into Rachel's song. Frank's searching gaze around the room is arrested for a moment as though reacting to Rachel's voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel ends a phrase. She dabs at the corner of her eye as she continues the song that still binds them together.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: His expression, so intense in the opening scene of the film, is softer now. Rachel's voice continues as Frank carefully scans the room.
